90rshFnEg3UlaVHH9EcwNg.text: This place is a lot of fun to go to with a group of 6 people. I went for my friend's birthday and she had a party of 12. The line outside to purchase a $5 membership card (needed to play) was super long. Due to the cold weather, one would think the management here would come up with a more effective way to get the line moving. After getting the membership we went to the bar area and got the Pineapple punch golf bag drink ($16). We were told that we couldn't order the drink individually and that there had to be two ppl available to drink it. I think this is just some sort of gimmick to make people think that the drink is very large or very strong. The drink was neither. It was an average sized drink and pretty watered down. And I wasn't impressed by the taste. But you get to take the nice golf bag cup home that lights up... So that's a plus. I also ordered the Kentucky Caramel coffee which is Jim Beam, Kahlua, caramel sauce, coffee, with whipped cream and 2 donut holes on top. It was underwhelming, but drinkable. The donut holes are really good though.  We went to our bay (which they put both halves of our party side by side b/c there is a 6 person max per bay). The game was super fun even though I wasn't good at it and if you don't have 6 people in your party... I will say that the price is kind of high especially at night.   I ordered the chili with a side of french fries. The chili was a little bit on the greasy side but it had good flavor. The cornbread that was given on top of the chili had jalapenos and cheese in it, so it had good potential but the only issue was that it wasn't fully cooked. The fries were a disappointment. I would suggest eating before you come to top golf to avoid disappointment. But it was an overall good time.

dN0TaXgu2yimnWIDiJKOyw.text: I wasn't excited about going to Topgolf in the beginning but cousin wanted to for her birthday so I agreed. The place is very busy but when I sat at a table for a bite to eat the staff was quick, efficient and the food was good. I had fries and chicken tenders while I waited for the birthday girls and others. We got called for our bay. Although the weather was cold and bit rainy, we were toasty and dry! I was so excited about that. Even though the bays are partially outside you won't get cold or wet. The game was super easy and fun to play. I had a blast and would recommend it to any group for a great night out. The staff set everyone up for the computer to display our turns, checked on us periodically, and cashed us out when we were done. The prices were reasonable and you can just hold on to your membership card for next time. You have got to try it! Even if you're not good at golf you will have a great time!

OgYD63yd8wAZUDNUnzJvPw.text: Finally got to go back  Had so much fun it wasn't busy but it was 1pm on a Thursday in March and cold outside- But not at Topgolf! The heated sofa is enough for me to go back on its own- I normally freeze and even while playing the heaters kept me warm - playing was super fun and easy and the food we got was all yummy - tried most all of the appetizers and sliders. Plus our server was right on top of it. Can't wait to go back again and again and again-  Keep up the great fun Topgolf! See you soon

jDX82QgQULAH0gGum_TX4Q.text: System was down my first time going. I had fun tho, our waiter was fun and personable.   Drink sizes were disappointing but not unexpected lol I have not eaten there yet but I will next time.

sAKoW65O1BfxnmI3nLnzvA.text: I've currently gone to Topgolf twice.The first time I went in the evening on a Saturday and there was a four hour wait.We literally received the text that our bay was ready after four hours but we had already left.However,while waiting we did enjoy the bar and food.I ordered the smoked apple bacon sandwich and it was to perfection.My friend ordered the macaroni bacon roll and stated it was good too.Our bartender Mike was awesome!There was a large crowd at the bar but he was able to handle it and still provide great service.  The second time I went on a Saturday midday.The wait was 2.5-3hrs wherein we did receive a bay in the expected time frame.We enjoyed the bar once again while we waited.The actual game is so much fun and way better than putt putt golf.We truly enjoyed ourselves and shared many laughs.The waitress for our bay was on point and served us effectively.Overall,we didn't have any complaints and will be back for another game.I recommend this place for any occasion.

Fri9ntBGWa3-pY38VBzuEg.text: Food is horrible but we weren't there for that, drinks are sugary, decent beer list. Golf bags are small

pTuFqbwXvipQxaRgttVmHQ.text: We were there for the Father's Day special which was $120 for two hours (much, much higher than a regular day). We had heard such good things we decided to do it as a splurge to honor my husband. We had fun but our computer had tons of glitches and a big lag time. It made it virtually impossible to keep an accurate score, since it would attribute one person's ball to another player etc. We did ask for help and were shown how to correct a score but could never get the computer to save our changes. We were told that sometimes the computers get too hot and don't function properly. That seems odd for an outdoor venue in the south. We also thought we were going to get an intro to the system and games etc but pretty much has to fend for ourselves which burned a lot of time. I might not have been as bothered had it been a half price day but for $120 for three of us to play for two hours I expected a lot more.

dO8Zyjs4BUuZelaTANJocA.text: We always enjoy our time at Topgolf.  Our most recent experience started out bad but Jenn, a manager, and our server Karen turned it around and as as always we had a blast.  Thank you for making it great!

xtsMyeiqEBfeJGZy3fEucw.text: If I could give this zero stars for service and customer satisfaction I would. You wait forever for a table, no one help you, it takes 30 mins to get WATERS and the staff act like they are pissed off 24/7. We ordered food, bar drinks and waters and the food came before the drinks....that's how long it took. Pathetic service. We love golf but will NOT be back.

iIhatBatVR_l5XDB1hqI3w.text: The food and drinks are delicious. I would have given 5 stars if it weren't for the parking lot. There are not enough parking spaces and maneuvering through the parking lot was almost dangerous.   Once inside you forget how much of a pain it was to park and enjoy multiple unique seating areas. BCGEdLg14Q_JJyaWtvk07Q.text: Such a fun place and the food is great! The wait is never long. It's a little pricey so not good for all the time, but I love it for a special night out.

1t2wdovNSJHxAg6sYvCf7Q.text: Topgolf is nothing short of an experience. It feels like a real life video game and is a blast for anyone who is accustomed to swinging a golf club or not. In addition you can expect decent grub and a wide selection of drinks to go along with a fun evening. It is definitely a place you want to take visitors if they are looking for a unique and interactive experience.  I'll start of with two asterisks: (1) my company has a platinum membership which affects my cost and experience and (2) I have only been during the middle of the day. I've seen the lines get long and heard it can be crazy in the evening, so you can take what I have to say with a grain of salt. That being said, the few times I have been have always been a blast. I am still amazed at the technology of the games. Essentially, you use an interactive screen to navigate different games and when it's your turn, you swipe your golf club over a laser sensor and a ball with a tracker pops out. Depending on where your ball goes (aiming for big targets here), you get points. It's fun to see what you can do and the scoring makes it a lot more entertaining than a driving range. Even if you aren't good at golf (like me), its still a great experience and I find that this place pulls a lot of newbies in so don't worry about standing out.  I had also mentioned the food earlier. I've had a burger, sliders, and chips/guac in the past and everything has been great. Some tips: make sure to get their early if you have never been, you need to get a membership card. Also this place can get crazy in peak hours - but everything lights up at night which is certainly a fun experience. Now go and check it out!

W1JUx8DL2DmSpdXqXCmqAQ.text: Visited Top Golf on Saturday afternoon. It was about an hour and half wait to golf so we had a bite to eat. Ordered some buffalo wings and plain wings...they were great! Fresh and hot. I also had a Tequila  sunrise which was made just right. By the time we were done eating I was receiving text saying our station was ready for golfing. It was fun and we did an hour. It was 33 degrees outside but they had heaters on outside. The wait staff offered a hot cup of water just for hold to keep hands warm. I thought that was a great gesture. Friendly staff, clean facility and a bit noisy on the inside, kids are allowed and appeared some birthday parties were going on. Since alcohol is served, I wouldn't suggest small children. But I'll definitely give it a 5Star

JohIIlDr-3dWD_S8w9SGJg.text: This place has rapidly gone down. Wait times of up-to 2 hours with priority for some platinum holders. The service hits a new low with missed orders and delays. Incidentally they also dropped water on my friends mom and had the audacity to laugh. I don't recommend this place to anyone..

-IuTPHpZZDIRASeLT6LKIw.text: I have been to top golf 3 times within the last 3 months and had an amazing experience the last 2 times. I felt really bad because I had talked this place up and brought 6 out of state guests here to visit. hjMISBMYtPUu4-GRzus20g.text: We LOVE Top Golf - seriously what's better than a driving range with food & cocktails??? My son (he's 8) begs to go all the time. We gave it a shot a couple of months ago and were gravely disappointed in the service we received. (It's taken me awhile to write the review). First off, the woman who waited on us was MEAN. When she pulled out a juice box and some fruit snacks for him, the waitress attacked, "you cannot eat outside food here" - everyone else ordered (extra) food and drinks .... we plead with her as this little boy literally eats NOTHING else. She was so annoyed she'd roll her eyes and look at us like we were morons. We begged!!! Aggravated, She said she'd get a cup for his drink and honestly never returned. lyQCM8J9eMr5f6JgERxKBg.text: Tons of fun, hit balls at targets and play various games of your choosing. Great for the novice or the advanced golfer. Busy but still moved quickly. Good bar service and food that is very good for a driving range. Definitely worth a visit with a small group. I wouldn't go with a large group but prefer for like 4-6 people.

iPbQSrq91hB2qjQQ6TLVSg.text: I have heard of Topgolf from multiple people and was able to visit this pst weekend.  This place was jam packed and I had a sense of dread walking in to be pleasantly surprised of how organized the reservation and play process was!  The company's sends text to alert you of when your bay is ready, and you have a server who walks you through how to use the amenities at your bay and order food.  It was a Friday and they had a DJ which added fun and excitement to the ambience and the DJ was mindful to play family friendly music.  The place, even for a Friday night, was very family friendly.  We didn't feel out of place.   The team there is user friendly and are willing to answer our multiple questions.  I will definitely return and will like to try locations in other cities!

LmLDiIJMn_10CxYOA2ybUg.text: Don't let my photos fool you - this is the place to go if you are looking for slow service, sassy service, mischarges, and cold food. Is anyone looking for those things though?   I heard the HYPE around Topgolf and was really excited to take my mind off Hurricane Irma at Topgolf with some family. Unfortunately, the experience was one of the worst I've ever had. Please note: this is only my 2nd 1st review EVER.  The line was out the door, so I assumed that the hype was right and it would be worth the wait. We were quoted about an hour or two for a bay, but we didn't have a problem with that since we were hungry. We went to an open rooftop bar to grab drinks and lunch. After 30 minutes, we realized that we weren't going to be served without hunting someone down.  Finally, we ordered and got our drinks. First, they brought out four appetizers when we only ordered two. Unfortunately, our server had us pay BEFORE we got our food since we were going to move to a bay, and we paid an extra $18 for the two appetizers that we didn't order. Granted that's our fault for not paying closer attention to the bill.  We moved to the bay, and our server told us that he'd have our food brought to the new bay. When it finally came, there were a lot of missing items from the order, and the food was cold. Most likely, the food had been sitting for a while since our first server was not very bright. Our server at the bay didn't make our experience any better. I actually ordered two more beers from a server at another bay since our server Jessie never came back for us. Corrie was the server that I hunted down, and he did get me the two beers but I had to open a separate tab with him.  The manager did stop by but her customer service skills were no better than anyone else that we interacted with. She blamed us for the problem, didn't listen to the situation, and didn't have any resolution before she just walked away...  Your money and time would be better spent somewhere else. The IDEA is fantastic, but the execution is horrible.

62Pk6o48TYEZDT_hgLR80w.text: You know...I'm actually sad to leave this review. My SO and I have been to Topgolf locations in 4 states now, and this one has left MUCH to be desired.   We arrived around 11:30am on the day after Christmas. We got a bay on the first floor because there wasn't a wait (45m+ for the 2nd d 3rd level). I needed a set of left hand clubs, which are usually sent down to the bay...but at this location you take them yourself (not an issue, just noting one of the differences in our experience). Now, where the issues did start were once we got to our bay.   When I got downstairs I was still waiting for my SO, who was walking his service pup before coming in. One of the staff members was at the bay waiting for us to get things set up. I put in our member info and told her I was waiting for the second player. She asked if I knew what to do next, I told her we did....and then she pressed start on our time...which begins the *paid* time...even though not all party members were present. She disappeared before I could say anything. Within seconds our server came and I brought it up with him and he had a dismissive, "Yeah, there's nothing we can do once the time starts. You can start without the other person. What can I get you to drink?" attitude. I don't know about others, but typically we like to settle in to our spot and get set up before starting (you know, like having all members of the party present and such). We lost about 15min of play.   Other issues: When the server brought my drink, he took my SOs order and a food order. The drink arrived 15m later after being asked about it and the food arrived 10m before the end of our game...all we ordered was the toast trio. We saw a staff member a total of 3 times during our visit (that we didn't have to actively seek out), the third time of course was when we were asked if we wanted to extend our time. Go figure.  Overall, this was an extremely disappointing experience that based on what we have experienced with other locations, is not at all what we expected.

BRM7cm9s5hP_K2yeaCMlzg.text: If you come here definitely get here early bc you wait possibly up to 2 hours for your bay to get ready. However, while you wait you can get food And drinks which is a plus. The only downside i had was that it took forever for a waitress to acknowledge us. We had to physically go search for a person after asking waitresses that were waiting in tables near us . That made the experience less than enjoyable.

xE28ncEk0l5kOC4jw7Jmmw.text: This place is pretty darn fun. There are frequently discounts on Groupon too, or for other various qualifying groups (never hurts to ask)! Ct4W6Js2KWp_y0Da3Hmz9w.text: As an experience this is 5 stars, but I have a hard time giving 5 stars (so that's on me).  First tip is go ahead and get your $5.00 membership online before you go so you don't have to stand in the line to even do that.  There are other membership levels available as well.  Once you have your QR code you can go directly to the concierge and they will print your card.  Once you have your card you can take that to the desk and they will put you on the list for the next available bay.  You can pay a fee to jump the line, but if it's super busy it may not be worth it.    Another tip is to make sure everyone has their own membership and card ready to go.  If you're trying to play off of one card you can, but it makes it difficult to keep up with scores if there are more than two or three people.  It is a game system so it isn't a typical driving range although I guess you could make it that if you wanted.  All the balls are gps chipped so that it will tell you if you scored points, distance etc...  It's really just a fun party atmosphere though.  If you're looking for a nice peaceful driving range experience this isn't for you.  Also if you have children that will be offended or emotionally disturbed by loud vulgar language and loud boorish behaviors by people drinking and partying then be advised you might be sitting next to that.  I'm sure staff wouldn't let it get too out of hand, but there you go;  it's several bars with a driving range.   There are three levels and I'm not sure if it's every night, but the 3rd level area turns into a dance party at some point in the evenings and the range/games are lit up and adjust in time to the music.  Way cool.  Once they text you that your bay will be available they will escort you to it and get you set up with your server and show you how to set up for game play and how to extend time etc...  The hosts and servers are all very good and nice and accommodating.  They have full bar service and standard bar food.  It is expensive and you will spend more than you think you will so it may say $$$31-60 but you will pay $$$$ over $61 almost guaranteed.  Another tip is that there are price differences depending on when you go.  Sometimes you get there early for the lower price, but you don't get in before the rates go up, so be aware of that.  Every bay is equipped with lounge seating, tv display for the range and another tv that seems to be set to the same channel, but you might have the option to change it to another channel for your viewing pleasure...not sure, but probably.  It is loud, it is hot but it's a fun change of pace and I'm glad it's here!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

D46DSiMh44snQBj2F4j8CA.text: I like next door to this place  and believe it or not this was my first time here.  Since they are always packed I decided to make a reservation for my husband and I on a Sunday evening. For my surprise to get a reservation I had to pay I reservation fee. Which was fine by me but I thought it was weird. We got there 5 minutes before our appointment and the lady said we would have to wait until they had a free land for us. ????? So what was the point of me paying for a reservation? Anyways, we went to the bar ordered some drinks and an appetizer that was really good. We had a type of spring roll filled with Mac and cheese and bacon that was really good! In general their menu is pretty decent and not expensive at all. I was expecting some exorbitant prices for the food but fortunately I was wrong. After 15 minutes I got a text on my phone saying our lane was ready. When we get there a member of their staff was waiting for us and explained how everything worked. I decided to order a hamburger and my husband a chicken sandwich. The food was good, even tho they messed up our sides we decided just go with it and did not asked to have it switched.  The place is fun, it is an ambient for all ages and you don't need to be a golf pro to have fun!  I will probably be back at some point. However, I was really expecting way more from this place.

_IPbojsRTiV3L2rB5191dw.text: I love the atmosphere and the whole idea but the service was so bad. We waited two hours which was understandable but then we're sat and we're not greeted for 30 minutes. Our waitress... Nicole C. Proceeded to greet all other tables around us. It appeared she only had three tables the entire night but checked on us maybe 3 times in three hours. She forgot to ring in our wings and took 20 to 30 to bring out more drinks. For a place that we have to pay 45 dollars an hour you would think the service would be at least okay. I want to come back but will probably eat and drink before hand next time. I even asked for a manager at one point and she really didn't care. Being a former server it was probably the worst service I've had.

iiRO1doId0biOWUQC9edyA.text: Awful service. Awful wait. Awful prices. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. If the franchise as a whole operates so poorly, I can't imagine how it remains a viable business or why anyone would visit. The servers and bartenders spent more time standing and chatting than I did.

8KtZBq35g5dO0dHKNrXA6Q.text: Had a terrible experience, waited in line for 10 minutes, $5 membership, drivers license and email address provided and then they tell me there's a 2.5 hour waiting to hit the ball!!!! I decided not to get a membership since I wasn't playing, I go to the bar for a cold one, waited 15 minutes at the bar with no luck. At this point I decide to take my crew and go bowling horrible place, not recommended until they get their act together.

Hrzuz8t2FBZ120eU5CgwdA.text: Definitely had a better experience today than I did on opening night. I suppose I showed up at just the right time because there was no wait. Checked in swiftly and with about a 5 or 10 minute wait was at a bay. Wait staff just needs to work out some kinks and familiarize themselves with the menu better. Also ensuring tables in the bays are properly equipped upon being seating with napkins/silverware (I had to ask for these items twice). Sadly there is still no assistance with parking which is a major ISSUE. It's two lanes in/out. To lessen the headache with parking, once I reached the front I just paid the $5 for valet. When people start parking on the side of the road it limits the lanes down to one, which makes it difficult for vehicles in both directions. For smaller groups (three in my party) I think an hour is plenty, larger groups defined would recommend 2 hours. Looking forward to returning and glad to see Topgolf here in the Queen City.

CNly7nG62bVvQ97ksWZAuQ.text: What do you do with a dozen hockey players for an afternoon when you have a long time between games? Top Golf, of course! This Top Golf facility was Top Notch, and the staff was incredibly helpful and went above and beyond. Keke, was able to get all the boys situated and set up to play. Our server was DeShawn and he was absolutely wonderful. Handled all the multiple food and drink orders and was always ready to assist us with whatever we needed. This was a great experience and our players had a really good time, blowing off pre-game energy.  From the Piedmont Predators, thank you DeShawn and Top Golf Charlotte.

HWtrLXfo21lCODU-Aw39Sg.text: Tried this new spot in Charlotte, with the expectation that I would receive the same experience I received in Tampa. The wait time/crowd was to be expected for a Friday afternoon, but what wasn't expected was the following: 1. Cashier who took my payment entered the amount of cash I gave to her and neglected to give me the proper change. 2. Waited 15mins after receiving our bay to be greeted by a server 3. Once our food was received, there was hair in one of the wraps we ordered and debris in our water glass 4. We had to wait another 30mins for the crew to switch out before we were able to get any refills (mind you it is almost 100 degrees outside)  Maybe they need to hire more competent employees or maybe they haven't been able to adjust with the amount of business they are receiving. Hopefully it will get better.

6_Yax5gY46byCxDJDH9x1Q.text: It's a great casual golf experience. The customer service is horrible. We waited for our food for over an hour. When we finally got our food my husbands chicken wings were still bleeding. I explained this issue to the manager and she convinced me that the wings sometime just have "veins" that bleed. Not satisfied at all. Eat before you come would be by suggestion. It's not the money for the horrible food.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chicken was still bleeding and the manager told me it is &#34;just the way the chicken was built&#34;.

xtL58wsLlofPSnrY4atZtg.text: I came here for a work team building event and we had a great time! Not the sportiest group but everyone enjoyed themselves. The staff was amazing and made sure we had everything we needed and explained how to play a game that would be good for everyone. The food was also really good and reasonably priced. We went the the outdoor bar on the third floor after and it was a good place to have a drink on a nice day! Plus ours came in a cool golf cup with a golf straw! Top Golf is a fun place for everyone, whether you're great at golf or have never swung a club. I'd definitely go back with my friends!

kDs482tCCIi60iou0UrAiw.text: We arrived at 4:15 on a Wednesday so it was busy but not like a weekend. Service was horrendous. We waited about 20 minutes for a server. I finally asked an employee who said he would find a server and send them over. Another 5-10 minutes pass and still no server. There were a ton of employees passing through but no one even looked at us. I headed upstairs to find a manager and finally they sent a server to our table. The manager said "they had been going through a transition".   Finally ordered food. My husband ordered chicken wings and he said they were the worst wings he had ever had. One of the pieces did not look like any distinguishable piece of chicken I had ever seen.   When we went to golf, the server was no wheee to be found. I asked another one how it worked to transfer the ticket. He told me to come back after we knew what bay we were assigned to. I did and the waitress had already closed out the ticket because she assumed we left.  Another hassle to get the ticket reopened.   The golf was not scoring properly so we had 3 different staff members troubleshooting throughout the time.   Overall, the concept should have been fun but they need to train their staff and add a lot more customer service skills. We will not return.

a3BQ8BI90G0dH-XFB1-WSg.text: Went here for a buisness meeting with a client. It was a Thursday night, and I was surpised on how crowded it was. I dont like that you cant make reservations ahead of time, so I had to make my client wait when we got there. It seemed to take the girl a really long time to make our top golf playing car, I was just having mine reprinted and my client was getting a new one and it took about 10 minutes just to get our card. Then we had to go over to try to get a lane which he said the wait would be 15 mins.  We waited at the bar and ordered some drinks and food, thinking we could just take the food to the lane when we got it. Well our lane took a lot longer than he said so we had our food and no where to sit, so it was kind of awkward. The lane took 40 mins.  With all that being said, the actually game of top golf was awesome! We had a lot of fun, and it was not as expensive as I thought it would be. All in all it was a good time, but I think I will wait till it dies down so the wait wont be so long.

GGasrdj4NsadfDQOoTVpLQ.text: This was an awful experience due to the fact that was a long line just to pay for a $5.00 membership and wait 2.5 hours to play. The Bar area was bad as well bad service over all. This management needs to get a better customer service acknowledging potential customer. Bad, bad don't go there on a holiday or weekends. Never go there.

9cTKrBHCoa9vPVZftNLxZg.text: Be prepared to wait! You will wait in line to get a membership card if you don't already have one. You will wait in line for a concierge to request a bay. You will wait for a bay. I went at 2pm on a Friday (not a holiday) and there was a 45 minute wait. Also, most of the couches are on the bottom floor so if you want to be off of the ground... Expect a high table/chair situation. The injectable doughnut holes with the cream are amazing. I loved the syringes they put the injectable stuff in.

Rgg3x9ptp7emAW2mQcPpcQ.text: This place lives up to the hype and I can foresee multiple locations in our area. As a non golfer one I picked the clubs up I didn't want to put them down

WEytodxC0N8spDxEYd9bww.text: Great fun for the entire family. Food has been spot on. Kiddos love the pizza. But, if you are at the bar or just sitting to eat, waiting on staff is a bit too long. This is our new fav!!

C24X5gsgyJ6zfuqSOHXR7g.text: Love this place! The food is great and there's such a variety of cocktails! The emery is so positive and it's a great outing for all ages. Hands down one of my favorite places in charlotte. They cover all bases!

0LC7OrFbQzAYrU-6ShP4Sg.text: Ahh Top Golf, you are an enigma to me.....some of my experience was an over the top 5 star review and some of it wasn't worth a 1 and probably more deservedly needs a call to the health department. Many people have complained about the check-in....it's a little ludicrous, but a little research will save you time (Pro tip: get your membership ahead of time and reserve your bay early).  The one BIG plus...for this place being such a madhouse, none of the employees were rude or pushy. The game itself was great. Staff explained options and it was just fun. This the 5 star part. I'm not a golfer, but it's kind of like a high-end bowling alley...but golf. The food was good too. Now the zero..... Bathrooms!!! Top Golf needs more or they need to keep them monitored. It's just unacceptable to have the ladies room closed especially when you're on a 5-hour wait. The men's room was open but it such a sorry state the health department would have closed them down. I usually don't' advertise when I puke, but that great BBQ Grilled Cheese I had eaten an hour before came right up because of the nausea inducing men's room.  Besides the checkin and the bathrooms this was a pretty fun night, but I would wait until the new factor wears off before returning.

6B0hdFwjtEz_DHsZfkmCaQ.text: I had high expectations for Top Golf based on my husbands experience at the Las Vegas location. Unfortunately, Top Golf Charlotte let me down. This location is 1) Disorganized (besides the fact the staff looks like they don't know what's going on, they verbally confirmed they didn't know what was going on) and 2) Unprofessional (it appears they have no training or expectations on the customer service level they expect out of their staff i.e. not attentive, wrong items brought to us, SLOW service, heard the concierge service argue with the booth host who should explain the rules once we got into the booth= Pathetic). Why spend your hard earned money here when you can go to another driving range? NOT WORTH IT.

WBjfrKil5RC4QDjlCp2yRQ.text: Very disappointed. For the first time in my life I did not leave a tip. From the moment I got there Alexis acted like being there was a bother to her. As I walked up - her face looking perturbed - she asked if we had a reservation for the bay. She didn't realize that a staff member was following behind us. Thirty minutes later we saw her again and she advised she had an event that she was setting up for and that she wasn't supposed to have anyone in our section and apologized for the delay in coming to us. We let her know it was no problem and no need to apologize. From that point on we saw her sporadically. Everyone in our group had to ask for drinks and items multiple times. She constantly cut and rolled her eyes, never picked up plates, never refilled drinks, and every request seemed to be a nuisance to her. I asked for to go boxes twice and 40 minutes later we had not received the Togo boxes. . . We let her know a third time that we still had not gotten them and her response "I'm grabbing them (pointed in a general direction) I had other stuff I was doing." Then proceeds to reach in the drawer DIRECTLY behind us and grab to go boxes. Ridiculous. TopGolf is usually a great experience. But this week Alexis ruined the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unfilled drinks and empty plates. We were there for over 3 hours those plates were there half the time.

pLpdFDkx7XMdfkF-TfpVTg.text: Make sure you do not book your golf time online unless you want to pay an extra $25-$50 just for the reservation. This does not include your golf time.  Also be ready to pay an additional $5 per person to get a required registration card.  Read the fine print!  The management would not refund even though we explained we did not make a reservation.

cmB5FmKgDBhYYEVatimGBw.text: We had recently been to top golf in Tampa and had a blast. Service and accommodations were comfy there, with soft couches and large scoreboards. When we tried the Charlotte location we were disappointed. Loud music was playing which meant it was difficult to talk. Instead of relaxing couches there were high top tables and chairs. And the scoring screens were small, overshadowed by tv channels playing above. Still a fun time but a bit more cheesy and "in your face" kind of atmosphere.

LvUdqDhA8DMtTbt0y1lZnw.text: Service sucks. Waited at a dirty table for 15 minutes .. seated ourselves , it took another 15 for our order to be taken. Give dirty utensils, use caution , before putting food on your fork here . Fun place . MANAGEMENT needs to do a lot more with their staff etc

H4tcs25RvGpQ4umxq2eQBQ.text: Normally I love this place but holy cow the bartender on the third floor was so rude. I can't count how many times she was so disrespectful, rolled her eyes and blamed things/ put all the work on the server. Hopefully this improves because we do many company gatherings here but I won't be back for a while.

NrAstsJHdYzBwGqPFiN46g.text: Went late at night with a group of 5 people! Tristan helped us out and he was super kind getting us all set up! Our server was nice and very attentive! Great weather, atmosphere, drinks, and company! Will come back! Cheese fries were dank! Great experience

w971YSuji4CQEovdb4PBYA.text: It's a super cool concept of a place but they seem too busy to provide good service and put that busy schedule above good service. For example, my boyfriend had just finished up our game and I was finishing up my glass of wine but instead of allowing me to do so they made me get up from our table and go stand off to the side to stand and finish my wine before leaving just so they could go ahead and sit the next people at our table. We're paying customers, actually already paid customers, so that was just wrong.

xispbrSViNkWHB-coN8y0Q.text: Had a three hour wait tonight which we didn't mind at first because the experience is usually worth it. No one ever asked us how many people were in our party so when we finally got our lane our party of eight was cramped and the computer system did not accept more than six which led to a lot of confusion. The person that rang us in said we could switch the names around during the second game which wasn't the case. When we ran out of balls we waited a little for someone to come add some- didn't really take too long but asked that we be reimbursed for the time that was used while we waited (probably about ten minutes) and our waitress rolled her eyes at us for the SECOND time tonight. Prince was her name. Too much attitude and not enough pants. Usually love it but kind of embarrassed that we dragged friends out to wait forever for such shitty service. The bartender upstairs by the stage wasn't our server but was super nice.

k_Mf97ynguME4prw0tYYGg.text: We spent a few hours here for a friends birthday (Christmas time) and the experience and atmosphere was great and lots of fun! There was a wait but that was expected for a holiday weekend. They allow you to wait at the upper or lower bar, order food, order drinks, and mingle with other guest. The ladies room is very clean. The staff was very nice considering who busy it was and how flustered some of them were. The only thing I didn't like was that you HAD to have your membership card with you or pay another $5 to receive a new card. Obviously it's another way to make money but it's frustrating. There should be a system that customers should be able to attend without physically having a card. Prices are great. Food was even better. Well worth the trip and will definitely be back again soon.

64gw50jb-0XLzFuWT9IE0w.text: No power again today. Second time we came and no power??? Great place when they have power.

vIQYso5KUr-Lvtq35ZdDkA.text: We live 35-40 minutes out and we called before we left. The person on the phone told us it would be an hour wait. We drove all the way here just to be told that it would actually be a 3-4 hour wait with 60 people on the waiting list. This is the third time this has happened to us and the fourth time this has happened to our friend. This is absolutely ridiculous terrible customer service. We asked the person at the desk why we were told 1 hour when it was actually 3-4 and she told us that the main desk doesn't even have a number that you can call, only the main office does. The main office does not even know the actual waiting times. We are mostly angry because the main office was just the corporate office that has no real connection to what is going on. Terrible, terrible customer service. I understand that we could have made reservations, but this was a last minute decision and we called in advance. Plus even if we did, we would have to pay a fee just to reserve a bay. And the fee doesn't goes towards the cost, it is purely a fee for reserving the actual bay and from what we were told at the desk it would have been a $50 reservation fee.

N6xzuDQY9s5oZlQekdVvGw.text: I went here to celebrate my buddies birthday and it was a pretty good time. The beer was cold, the wings were good, and the golf was fun. We had to wait a while on a bay to start but other than that no real issues other than it being slightly pricy. Reccomended.

GOtY8V28H8lyug9OJHA5OQ.text: Service inside the restaurant is awful. Had to bus my own table and it took 45 mins for drinks to end up on the table. The golf is of course fun but you're better off not eating here or waiting to get drinks till you're in a bay.

c8ObOB5MGiBPFurXoqWwsQ.text: Great place for entertainment. Food is awesome. Nachos were amazing. Great service. 9 fun games to play. Only complaint is that the clubs they provide aren't great. I usually hit my driver 220 but theirs only hit 190. Very kind service and an awesome place to go with friends or family. And it doesn't matter how good you are at golf it's still fun

5rM3jxtRO1NMCGtS9L2sRQ.text: There nothing is can say that would give proper credit to this awesome place. This place goes down as my all time favorite.

gjh_PzPqIqFeiP6GBBR55g.text: I truly love Top Golf and have had several great experiences in both Nashville and Atlanta, but this was different. Overall, we had fun and the food was good, but the service was definitely lacking. One of the food runners rolled his eyes when we asked for a to go box....

09i_zt0wkyVxppFJZlPGjA.text: Great place that could be even better with a better staff! Both bartenders we encountered seemed annoyed to even serve us. We asked for waters to go with our drinks and the bartender made passive aggressive comments as we walked away. For being such a new place you would think they would not be so bitter about working there. We will give it one more try.

pYkhre9fVaf4lzfaMKXX8Q.text: Yesterday was my first visit to topgolf. I always wanted to try their food because everybody say that is really good. While we were playing golf, nobody came to ask us if we wanted something to eat, so we decided to wait until the end of our time to eat. So when we went inside, so waited there if like 20 minutes for somebody to come and take our order and no one came. So we told one of the crew about it and she said to sit on the bar so we can order. When we sit on the bar they tell us that we can't be there because we weren't 21 ( understandable). But we go back to our seats nobody come to take our orders and two girls that got there later than us were took care of before us.

4NmRqwaH7HoI2E8Hor1MgQ.text: Have been here multiple times and usually have a decent time. We had some drinks at the bar which was fine and bartender was really good. However when we finally got to our bay and ordered our food, they forgot part of our appetizer order and therefore an item came to us towards the end of our game. We constantly had to repeated requests for napkins but none of this was really a big deal. As we waited to check out, they charged us for a membership fee even though we already had memberships. This was resolved. But when one member of our party asked for a box to take home the item that came late, the red-shirted Kelly, cleared away the food without asking and was very rude to our party. No apology for the mistake. But only muttered that she would replace the order, however didn't even wait for our response. The two servers were nice and were more concerned about the mistake than she was. We were polite the entire time but Kelly was not.

v_d3OssZlq7nq9BcGUnOlg.text: Went tonight with a party of 4 kids and 4 adults. Service was great start to finish, prices were totally fair, and the food was surprisingly good. Special thanks to employee, Bryant. He was so polite and helpful (especially when my son spilled an entire glass of water everywhere). I can guarantee we will be back regularly. Might have to plan an adult party or two ;)

NwSXX38Fq38XjMPF8_kXAQ.text: Hopefully I experienced opening jitters..!! The staff is ill prepared and ill trained to handle the volume of patrons they currently have. Customer service is not good at this time.  30 minute wait on Thursday afternoon. Got to golf bay and computer didn't work. Took 15-20 minutes for the "guest services" person to be found and show up. 10 minutes later he was frustrated but got it going and comped us an extra hour. 40 minutes in, the entire establishment blacked out and our computer locked up again. Don't forget your waiter is just that..a waiter..they are not educated in the ways of anything but bringing food. But she did try and find the "guest services" person who eventually showed up after my brother raised cane..!!  After he showed up..it took this guy 10-15 minutes to reset the computer then he realized the bay had been rented for a corporate outing and made us move..!!! but he also comped us another hour and an appetizer for the problems. So we moved. Card still has 2 hours of play time on it but we decided to leave after playing only 1 hour. Leaving 1 hour of play time on the card. No where on the computer is there a place to click to save unused time..!!!  Again, waiter has now idea how to save time or even if you can. Waited for "guest services " 5-10 minutes, we went to the main counter and was told YOU CAN NOT SAVE UNUSED TIME. WE WERE TOLD YOU MUST HAVE A "GUEST SERVICE" PERSON COME TO YOU BOOTH AND DO THIS FOR YOU.  A very aggravating afternoon.

xXOd7KOZFZU2PCD9oyuDRw.text: This was my very first visit to Topgolf. Hopefully it's not like this in every Topgolf location. For now, this review is only for their restaurant on the main level. Service was extremely poor. Took about 15 mins to get somebody to clean our table. Then it took about an extra 15 mins to get our order. Then our drinks never came. Food arrives about 25 mins after we ordered and still no drinks yet. My wife had to personally get our drinks from the bar and bring them to our table! Just terrible service. Food was just okay. We ordered the following: 1. Pepperoni Flatbread - we requested the pepperoni to be placed on the side coz my daughter doesn't eat them, and when the server brought it to our table, he accidentally dropped all the pepperoni on the floor, stared at it and picked them up and never returned with a replacement pepperoni! Unbelievable! Taste was good. 2. The G.O.A.T. Which is a caramelized french toast, maple syrup, Cap'n Crunch breaded fried chicken, jalapeno gravy, over easy egg, green onion, chopped bacon, Cholula. - this was actually pretty good. 3. Veggie Burger - my wife did not like it. So don't order this when you are here. They were a bit quicker when they want you to pay your check. Totally the opposite of when we were about to order. They were so hard to get their attention when you need them. It even seems like they were avoiding us. But when it comes to the check, we didn't even call them and they were there asking if we wanted the check.  Our current wait time for golf is 2.5 hours, so I don't know about the golf aspect of Topgolf yet. Hope it gets better than here.

th4fjE7NZzpw5ofb2O1Abg.text: This place continues to go down hill with their level of service.  If go into detail but there isnt enough space in this forum.  It starts at thr concierge desk and continues once you get into the bay.  I'd offer suggestions for improvement but doubt anyone cares to hear it.

vcFGF_kmLvIu7SUCHcQkwg.text: Fun but overrated. Came here on a late Saturday morning and they weren't terribly busy. We found a parking and didn't use the valet. Wait was approx 1.5 hours but we only waited an hour. We were at the very top which was actually pretty nice. This place nickel and dimes you. You have to pay for a membership in addition to paying hourly. Membership is $5 but it adds up. Also, you can make reservations for $50 but the $50 does NOT go towards your payment. The area was cool and not too hot. We played for an hour with 4 people total and it really wasn't that bad time wise. We could of played another hour if we wanted but we were a little over it.  I'm glad I came to try this place out but I'm not really interested in coming back unless someone really wanted to.

rT0ExuX9e1UyTOxubP205w.text: We have been coming to Top Golf regularly since it opened. We typically have a really enjoyable time. Last night that was not the case. My dad flew into town to visit and us kids that live in NC wanted to treat him to a dinner and Top Golf for Father's Day. It was his first time ever going and we were so excited to show him what a great time it is. He was also really, really excited (he typically stays with the grandkids and babysits when we all go)   The whole night was so disappointing. We are 100% fine waiting for a bay...we do nearly every time we go. However, that wasn't the problem. Last night the service was so bad. Took 55 minutes to get food and our server just seemed so absentminded. She was sweet - but we had to ask for plates, silverware and refills. We were there for 2 hours and we only got one refill. The food was cold when it got to us and just not very good. We always order the same thing and they were sold out of some of the items and the ones we got weren't as good as usual.   The experience of golfing was off too! A large amount of our balls weren't registering. In the 2 hours we were there the balls weren't cleared once and the place was covered in golf balls. It looked like snow in some areas there were so many accumulated. Most of our balls were bouncing and ricocheting off others, which really messes with the score.   I would've given 2 stars based on our experience last night but majority of the time we go there it's great so that doesn't feel right. My main concern is the company is getting casual now that the hype has gone down.

zlLSXaFJ2EsibGmDr1-qRA.text: This is one of my favorite place in Charlotte. If you have more people that's the True fun come here, most busiest on weekends.

uI3PpngLW1n9YAz8VbrdYw.text: I've obviously heard of Top Golf, but my first Top Golf experience was at this Charlotte location. We stopped here after brunch on a Sunday WITHOUT reservations. *Note- I would definitely make reservations before coming here so that you don't have to wait as long and you can get a bay that is on one of the upper floors. We got a bay on ground level, and while it was fun, I think it would have been more fun being higher up. Anyways, we had to wait for about 30 min and then we were set up at a bay. Everything is pretty self explanatory, but there was employees walking around in case you have any questions. I did have to request left handed clubs and they brought them over very quickly. Top Golf is like being at a driving range, but you compete with your group by getting points based on the targets you hit. You don't have to be Tiger Woods out here- Top Golf is made for golfers of all expertise- or lack thereof, in my case. I'm so happy there is a Top Golf where I live, so that I can go again. It was definitely a fun experience and a good way to get out of the house to do something fun!

DE3l-v4dhXwlFBY_Y5Pvpg.text: AHHH I LOVE TOPGOLF!  Honestly, Top Golf is so much fun. It's essentially a driving range but they added games to it so it can be enjoyed by golf connoisseurs and your average Joe (i.e. me).   Me and my friends came here at like 9 pm and rooms are about $45 a pop after 5pm so it's kinda pricey but it's not bad if you split it! The room can hold up to 6 people and they also have military discount.   The staff at Top Golf are very help at explaining the game and how everything works so don't worry about that. But if it is your first time you are required to pay for a membership which is like $5, but after that you never have to pay again (I hope).  The only reason I took off a star was because my boyfriend got a Long Island Iced Tea and it was super watered down. It had so much ice and tasted like it had almost no alcohol in it, so it wasn't really worth it.  Overall I would definitely go to TopGolf cuz it's super fun, just don't buy drinks here. At least not the Long Island

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. the front!

nNrGsCrlIiVJypxDs5iiXA.text: The Topgolf experience here is across the board and the same as it is at other Topgolfs. The food is mediocre, drinks are expensive and service is subpar when ordering from bays. My other and I really enjoy coming here, though. Staff is really great when you have any issues, questions or problems. Service at the bar isn't too shabby.

-uX0gS64x8v-DlhO_JcPdQ.text: When top golf first opened it was over crowded and wasn't worth the wait. But now that the crowd as died down i love going to just sit at the bar and enjoy the view, the menu choices are different but that's what i love. Drinks are strong but good, we have a sibling outing there at least once a month.

cQA7QoGqmK5MNRayZext5A.text: I've only been here once but I certainly see what all the hype is about! Top golf mimics a bowling alley in that you can rent your own lane and keep scores on different players in your group. It's a multilevel building with targets on the green for you to aim for. We had a catered event there, which was amazing (except for the DRIEST chicken I've ever had). Their drinks are tasty, but pricey. Overall, loved my top golf experience!

IB4VxW9KWTHyB-BwQWlyZg.text: Tried to order flatbread but was out of the bread. Food was subpar at the best. Had to ask for shot on the side for my Bloody Mary...tasted like all tomato juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Went and tried this place again and total got sick. Was talking to a friend and said they had gotten sick before when they ate there.

K9KKGfQahDmf1rH5nfmV6g.text: A restaurant with a really cool golf element.  I say it's a restaurant first because that's how they treat guest and most importantly, cook and serve their food. You'll consider coming here solely for a meal after experiencing the food for the first time. Look, it's not 5 Star, fine dining cuisine, but it's actually leaps and bounds better than any Applebee's, Chili's, or other garbage chain restaurant.   Everything from breakfast, to Asian, to Southwestern, Top Golf has it all and I've yet to have anything that's gross. Don't expect to get arcade or bowling alley quality of food; you can go to Dave and Busters for that crap.  If you're not a golfer, even if you have never swung a golf club, you will absolutely have a good time. This game is for everyone with any level of golfing skill (or not).   There's a lot to be said about a place that still has ridiculous long wait times even after being open for over a year. It's impressive and everything about the facility is impressive. You will undoubtedly have a blast. 5/5 and if I could give it more, I would.

93u-9clLOu02FZmzMx4uKw.text: Yeah, I suck at this, but I had a pretty good time!  Me and three of my friends rolled up on a Friday night around 8PM and despite it being very crowded we were able to get a bay on the lower level without a wait. It's a very simple concept, imagine combining a driving range with skee-ball and you've pretty much got a grasp of TopGolf!  While I had some really long drives, I was not accurate enough to make that translate to BIG points on the board. A few of my friends were VERY successful at racking up smaller, yet more consistent points by going for the closer targets. I was the stubborn one and would drive the ball 200+ yards trying to get the big, white target in the back, and failing miserably. I think I see why the middle and upper level are the ones that have the wait list. For one, the balls are very low-flying. I'm assuming this is because of the microchips inside, the dynamics are a bit different from your typical driving range. The other reason is you can't really follow your ball traveling to the target from the lower level, it must be much easier from the upper levels.  With regard to the food, we only got fries and chips w/ salsa and guac, but I was really surprised with the quality of both. To be honest, I was expecting the food to be of 'bowling alley' caliber but the Guacamole was very fresh, seasoned well, and had a great texture. Whether it was homemade or not, it was good enough to get me to order two in the same night! Next time we'll dive into the menu a bit more.  I have to give props to the staff, our waitress Tima was very attentive and checked in on us very frequently, not a single cup went empty! Dan the manager introduced himself as soon as we got to our bay. As we were leaving they were dealing with a guy who wanted to smoke inside AND drink outside, neither of which are allowed by local or state laws... I'm sure they must deal with stuff like this a lot but they did well.  I think with a bit more practice I could go pro. Looking into getting a jersey and I'm currently accepting sponsorship deals. Please send inquiries to my Yelp inbox!

PNpSvlwkdcCBDyN4fYhd2g.text: Topgolf is a blast! I have been here 3 times now each time with a different group of people. It seems to be an activity for all types and ages. My parents loved it and so did my friends. I am not a golfer and still had a great time. It is a casual environment and you have your own section. The prices once split amongst the group are more expensive than bowling but reasonable and way more fun than bowling. I went on a friday night at 7, Friday night at 5:30, and a Saturday afternoon. Each time we were able to find parking (sometimes harder than others but still possible).   My issues with Topgolf are the food and the service. All three times ordering food and drinks took so long as our server was very busy and hard to find. They rarely come by so I have learned to over order when the server is there. The food I have had there was sub par - tater tots were yummy with dipping sauces but the chicken sandwich was pretty average and dry.

Y11FQ07taD3A6zJYTgAfHw.text: This place is Awesome! I had a great time! If you love Golf and great drinks with friends and family, this is the place!! I had a lot of fun! We probably could have done it for several hours but it was a little crowded. The drinks were awesome. This Topgolf was New in Charlotte. I have been to a few others , but this one is way better. I highly recommend it.

VkwAqegjcRLe9rxlY8mdEA.text: For years i heard of Top golf in Atlanta where my sister resides, finally one was built here in Charlotte probably going on about two years now and  just now visiting, i know sad. Well i didn't get the full experience i went here with a friend to sit at the bar for drinks only, but while i was there we walked around and looked at all of the action that was going on and taking place. Ui-dhgL-l88W9gVauUZyHg.text: My first time here was SO much fun, so much unexpected fun. I'd heard good things , and knew they were expensive , but I was really surprised when I walked in.   There's so much space . There are 3 levels with bays. We ended up on the lowest level which was very nice. Our section has high top tables , and there are some booths as well.   There are heaters and fans to keep you comfortable in all seasons and a very accommodating waitstaff, who will help you get set up on your game and bring drinks and food. I had a strawberry margarita which was okay, and no food.  Once set up on the game , you get to choose from various male and female clubs to hit balls dispensed from a machine at your bay. The point is to shoot for accuracy . Accuracy being as close to one of the flags as possible.   They open as early as 9AM and stay open late. This is a great place to burn a lot of time , and fun while doing it.

LrHM3XvBkzU7ktBM9gbTJQ.text: Fun time for all!  No letter your skill level, they have a wide variety of games to keep things interesting. Decent food options and several beers on tap!

loKLTL6Mz5BTXbVuspIFwQ.text: So first thing, definitely book your bay online and in advance in order to avoid a wait! We came on Sunday and since my husband booked online we only had to wait about 15 minutes. It was pretty cool because we waited at the bar and got drinks and then we received a text message to let us know what bay we needed to go to.  When we got to the bay, an employee set us up and gave us a quick tutorial. Be advised if it's your first time you will be charged a one time $5 membership fee in order to play. The best part of this experience was that the bays were heated including the seats!   The food was also really good! The pizza had way too much oregano but the portions were big and the prices weren't bad at all! I think my favorite food that we ordered was the queso--so good!!!

Egx4SvvRmfIE5vI0pP9Nqg.text: So, I hate golf. Never have played. Love Topgolf. Fun, exciting, first class, upscale. Like playing golf IF your golf cart were your living room, the tee (is that even spelled right?) your man cave simulator, and somewhere they were a professional bartender and executive chef lurking in the background. Great cocktails and the most amazing 40-ounce burger and fries I've had eating out in years. Slice it pizza style and feed a crowd on the cheap. And who doesn't love injecting your own donut holes? Our waiter was great, too. Oh, that would be Deon.

N-7Bg5g8N-vS4TlmRs2ZVQ.text: Minus the long lines to get in we had a great time and would highly recommend.  Just don't get the chicken and waffles.  Frozen chicken as in like the kind you serve to your kids out of the freezer.  Too bad since it was almost $10.  We will be going back for sure.

woSdasst8u1lQto4jFKVFg.text: The service was horrendous. I ordered a bucket of bottles and it took 15 minutes. YTFKu9XH_8ZItH8KZpnuWA.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would! Me and my family went today as a Christmas present and the service was horrible! First, half my party was from out of town and they made everyone sign up for a membership card even though they don't live in the state and don't have a top golf by them and had to pay for the membership cards for them to only use once! We got food at the bar while waiting for a bay to open and the server waited around until 12 so we couldn't order brunch even though it was only 11:40  and brunch is over with at noon. They also don't have good sitting for older people my grandma had to fight the the bar stool because they were so high up and they have no tables to sit at to accommodate older people. We moved to our bay and no one told our server we moved so we waited almost 1  1/2 for food that wasn't even that good and our order wasn't even right and they had to remake it 3 times before getting a pizza with no cheese right due to a dairy allergy. Getting Togo boxes was a nightmare I ended up going to the kitchen door to ask for them from a kitchen member. Last but not least let's not forget it was so hot due to the heaters because they had them on way to high and the music speakers were way to loud I couldn't even talk without having to yell to my family. Overall one on the worst Christmas presents ever the staff is just so rude, snobby, and sassy from all employees including the manager!

nhJkyJGNdNzQguRgDNx2KA.text: This review is based solely on customer service.  We did not get the opportunity to try the food or the activities.  We came in on Monday at 3:30pm.  The place was busy but we noticed several empty bays.  We were quoted a 60 min wait when we walked in.  Seemed odd but no big deal.  By the time we got to the "concierge" it was up to 90 min because they had some events going on.  We decided to wait.  While we waited we saw over 30 empty bays that never filled in.  After 105 min I went back to the "concierge" to see what was going on.  She then quoted me another 2 hours!?  I immediately asked for my money back and was referred to the manager.  He said they had corporate events and they had to keep the bays open because they were not sure when they would come in.  5 minutes after we left I received a text that our bay was ready, what the heck?  Very unorganized but like another reviewer stated, people are going to keep coming so what do they care.

rJZ-rVZKnREhYge8F27fCg.text: Service is SO AWFUL. First, we were told we could sit on the rooftop patio to be served while we waited TWO HOURS for our bay to be ready (apparently, this is a normal wait time. Beware, you will also stand in line to even sign up for a bay. That took us about 30 minutes). As we were sitting after ordering our drinks and food at the bar, four servers came to the patio and started shutting everything down and made us feel like we weren't supposed to be there. No one ever brought us napkins, plates, or even asked if we were ok. Later in the day when we got to play the game, a family who was playing next to our bay left before their game time that they paid for ended, so they asked us to finish their play time. While hitting balls, a server came over to that bay and shut the game off on us.  We told him the family that just left asked us to finish the time they paid for.  He rolled his eyes and shrugged his shoulders as he said, "you aren't making me any money, so I don't care" as he was shutting down the bay. A manager did come over to apologize and he added that time onto our bay, but at that point, we were already turned off from the place. The game itself is amazing, too bad their staff isn't up to par. (Get it?). Such a shame. Hope they can step their game up and do better.

JzTjrwMjFsqZLRs4ljrVXw.text: First off, I'll say that the concept of TopGolf itself is great. The games are very fun, the drinks were great, and we had a great time. The issue we had was with the wait times and being taken advantage of because of the long wait times. The pricing per hour is as follows: $25 before 12pm, $35 between 12pm-5pm, $45 between 5pm-close. My party showed up BEFORE 11am. Upon arrival, they made us pay for the first hour of golf. This was BEFORE 12pm so the price was $25. We proceeded to wait for over an hour. This put us in the bay at 12:15pm. When we arrived at the bay, the worker informed us that we would have to pay an additional $10 to play because we weren't at our bay before 12pm. I just feel like it's an extremely skeezy business practice to force your patrons to pay in advance for the time they've chosen to play, but then force them to pay MORE money because workers couldn't get you to a bay in time. I wouldn't be as mad if this place was actually at capacity, but at least a fourth of the bays weren't even occupied while we were there. I guess it makes sense not to open all of the bays, because the longer patrons have to wait, the more money they'll have to spend on food and drinks. It's clear that this business is a complete money-grab that's taking advantage of patrons that have had to wait an excruciatingly long time just to play. On top of this, while we waited for our turn to play, it took us 20+ minutes (after asking for a waiter to come to our table) to get someone from the wait staff to take our drink orders. Hopefully I'll return at some point, but there's no way I could recommend this place without having to list the bad that goes along with it.

pKj4W_nXW5TOn59AkQlX4A.text: 5 stars for Idea, less for execution.  And why can't Uber, google maps and waze find this place yet?  Its a cool concept, futuristic citified golf.  But, long waits, mediocre food and not the most pleasant of staff make it not something I would do unless friends talked me into it.  I am not an avid golfer anyhow.  Food is alright, but nothing special.  I dunno, I really like the concept and there is no competition, so I'm sure they'll do well.  And I'll certainly go back.

JZoUgn1d3BZtA98F7jkALQ.text: If I could choose one word to describe this place it would be chaos. Having lived in Atlanta and frequenting the locations there often, the Charlotte location still has a little of kinks to iron out.   If you plan to go on a weekend evening, and don't want to reserve a bay, you're better off putting your name on the list and going to grab a sit down dinner somewhere else to cover your 3 hour wait. My girlfriend actually went back first thing Sunday morning and there was still an extended wait. Maybe the people that never got in Saturday night camped out   Bartenders were hardworking and efficient

LoQoTMnRPThhP3t3baLgpQ.text: Overall our experience with Topgolf was okay. We left with the distinct feeling they were overstaffed because there were employees everywhere but our interactions with the employees were ineffective.   When we arrived there were three employees at the door greeting people. We walked in to two lines and a bar. We weren't sure if the people we were meeting had a bay reserved or not and we weren't aware that we need our own players cards to play. We awkwardly stood around for several minutes and not one of the staff members said anything to us. When our friends arrived they told us we had to get our own membership and we got to queue up in line to get a card. Then after getting the card we got to queue up again to get a bay. You have to provide your ID, email and phone number to purchase your $5 membership which seemed excessive to me to hit a couple golf balls.  While getting us set up at a bay the staff member told us we could split the cost. Great! Except then he said he would have to over charge the card since he couldn't split the cost to exactly half. I looked at the screen and pointed out the charge for half the $35 rental fee ($17.50). I wonder how often people are overcharged because of this.  After the initial set up we were finally able to play! I actually enjoying the driving range, not being a golf person I like that the machine kept score for me and the targets were fairly large. Our waitress only brought one set of silverware for our dinner and several napkins. Perhaps this was on purpose since only my salad needed a fork? However I have never been to a restaurant that only gave one person silverware.   Our group of 4 got in two solid round of golfing and dinner and drinks in the one hour we were there. While discussing our experience on the way home I found out they charged my boyfriend $16 for my $12 margarita which was annoying but not worth turning around and going back to fix. I will say the margarita was small even for $12 and my salad wasn't very big considering it was supposed to be an entree.   Would I go back? Yes if someone invited me but I am in no rush to return. If I do go back it would probably be for beers and golf not for a full meal.

JZ4zgTqosVDFJR-4jK9GkA.text: This was my first Topgolf experience and I will be returning! I am not a golfer but I love playing games and I love beer lol this is great for a family activity or a group of friends! We came on a Friday night and there was a mix of people - families, dates, groups of friends, etc.   The guy who helped us at the front desk Paul was awesome and super helpful with setting us up since we'd never been before, and getting us into a bay area.  The lobby area is a little hectic with people waiting for bays... I didn't get a drink out here, but my friends did mention service was not as good in the lobby. But once you're in your area, your group has it's own space to sit/stand/hang out, and a server for drinks/food. Our server was helpful, checking back on us periodically!   We had a group of 6 people which I think is a good number to have in the bay playing at one time we played the normal/classic game. We played for 2 hours which at prime time (later in the evening) is $45/hour (they have variable pricing based on the time of day), which is why it's great to have a larger group to split the costs. In addition to the price of the bay, each player has to get a "membership card" which is a one-time $5 fee. This will track all of your stats which is the best part of playing if you're competitive like me!

5cdJo2thvFiUzxdlu6HEDQ.text: What a great fun place to go to !  The line to obtain a membership was a little long but it moved rather quickly.  I ate downstairs and the service was exceptional.  Our server was attentive and made sure my guest and I were taken care of.  There are poo tables and corn hole (I believe that's the name) and other little areas to just kick back and enjoy the social setting and of course there is the golfing areas as well.  I ordered the Mushi and a bottle of pinot grigio.  The wine was $29 and the mushi was a reasonable price as well. I would suggest going with a group of family/friends or date night! Definitely a go to!!!

2Q7ltJB-vuARVelPjDeJEg.text: Topgolf is a hole in one!  Opening weekend...who knows what we're walking into.  -Parked the car (parking might be quite difficult depending on day and time you're here)(There is also valet) -Waited in line to get a membership for $5 (45 minutes in the sun) -Waited in line to get a bay (Saturday evening...opening weekend)(20 minutes) -Escorted to our bay and given some instructions and advice (friendly and helpful) -Started whacking away as our server came and introduced himself -Ordered drinks...kept whacking -Extended our time to order more drinks and continue the whacking -Paid and left  What a great night! Sure...there will be kinks to work out of such a sizable and busy place. The place is an affordable date night, a fun place to come with friends or an interesting place to do some team building.  The golf range and games are incredibly fun. Even a novice will appreciate the simplicity of arriving with just themselves, finding clubs labeled to help them out, and games that are easy to understand. That horrible "sorta" swing will get better...I promise! You may have your neighbors trying to be friendly helpers though.  The service was as expected. They are busy. If you're the type of person that can't evaluate situational probabilities...don't write a review about how slow things are. If you didn't expect things to be a bit slower based on the parking lot and lines...maybe your expectations of divine intervention on the service is the problem.  There is music, television and wi-fi. There's a live DJ on the roof and it's essentially a night club later in the night. Be warned however, this place is loud at night! If you're looking to discuss business here...you might want to find somewhere a bit quieter.  My advice to Topgolf: More craft beer on tap...and a broader selection.  Topgolf is top notch!  Try: Coming here for date night  Avoid: Bringing the kids in the evening

SfuQutiaAx4w0hcbs1D95Q.text: Amber had the vegetable burger she said it was the fizzle . T Bone the grilled the grilled cheese he said it was soft in the middle crispy like a chip on the outside

448CAeogOwzA9p-fe--W3A.text: This place is amazing!!!! Opening on June 9th, 2017 this will be the Charlotte area's new "Go To Place."  The concept is simple, and brilliant. You come in, get a membership card (lifetime card costs $5) which you will use to pay for everything. You rent a bay and enjoy unlimited golf with your coworkers, friends or family while being waited on by friendly and fun staff members. The pricing model is simple - see my photos for current pricing at the time of the review. You pay for the bay, which can be split among members of your party if you wish. The bay is yours with unlimited balls for the duration you have it, and it includes your own two sets of clubs.  On the right (see photos) you will see clubs with Carolina Blue (GO HEELS!) inlay, those are women's flex. Those on the left are men's flex. They do not include gloves, so I suggest bringing your own as we did. You can also opt to bring your own clubs if you prefer.   Once at your bay, you set up your team (similar to the process at a bowling alley.) You can have up to 6 people per bay, and your bay has it's own private seating area and table, plus a dedicated TV you can control.  Each bay has a large outdoor heater, as well as a fan to help you stay comfortable. There are waiters who go around to get your food & drink orders. The food and drinks were fantastic! We tried everything from: * Jumbo shrimp with homemade cocktail sauce (not too spicy) with grated ginger & avocado * Mushi - Mexican sushi with a touch of Sriracha * Smoked Prime Rib * Charred broccolini * Deliciously soft roles and soft whipped butter (who doesn't love good bread & butter)? * Chopped Greek-style salad with pecans * Mini loaded potato wedges with ranch on the side * Fresh seared scallops * Donut holes with injectible fillings (raspberry jelly, chocolate, and Bavarian - don't be afraid to mix them up!)  I learned the hard way the donut injectors have caps that need screwed off. Take them off or you'll make a mess like I did! My favorite was mixing the rasberry with the creme. YUM!  The drink prices were reasonable and modest, and they have something for everyone. Should you have to wait for a bay (even though they have THREE levels of bays), you can grab a seat or a table at any level. (Again, see photos.)  There is abundant space to rent for meetings, conferences, weddings, banquets, birthdays, bachelor parties, etc. They can cater for whatever you need. They are also VERY sensitive to food allergies and unique dietary needs. Their cheeses were all pasteurized (for any fellow preggos out there), and they can accommodate allergies.  The overall vibe was friendly, fun and lighthearted. Great music flowed throughout, and at night when the targets are really glowing, the lights put on a show of sorts as they dance to the music.  When you're ready to golf, you simply grab your club, approach the mat and wave your ball over the large red dot in the top right of the target map (in front of your map). You'll know it worked because a green light will flash from the dispenser letting you know your micro-chipped ball is on its way. You can do this with your hand, or any club... The chip allows the system to keep your score and know which ball was yours. If you don't get it in a target, your score for that ball is 0. The further the target and closer to the center, the higher the score. Each "game" includes 20 balls. You get unlimited balls/games for the time you have the booth rented.   This was so much fun, and we can't wait to go back. It's conveniently located off 485 with ample parking. It's family friendly, could work for a work mixer, or as a quasi night-scene for drinks, dancing, food, and of course, golf.
