pLFvAJhcfRA0ysXWAnVycQ.text: My boyfriend and I were here to pregame before the Saints game, we had a blast...our server McCray was awesome, managers were accommodating, and the bays were heated! Cannot wait for the location in Greenville to open.

JPkG_7XZEQhpdHTiVbxwfQ.text: This is a great place for a team event or to go with a group of friends. We had no wait during lunch on a weekday or at 11:30 on a Sunday. The most popular game is a lot of fun and great for people who don't play golf. It's easy for those who don't hit the ball well to still get a decent amount of points making it to the targets. The food is also pretty good. The G.O.A.T and the injectable donut holes were my favorite menu items. The mac and cheese spring rolls, chicken and waffle sliders, buffalo chicken flatbread, and mushi were also very good. We enjoyed the Bloody Mary and Citrus Cabana as well. This is definitely a place worth checking out. We'll be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Injectable donut holes
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mushi
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. G.O.A.T.

WH_8Lp51WLNUVCZEIqTS5g.text: Topgolf is a fun place for a group of friends, for sure! There are plenty of options on the food and drinks menu, you can even hang out at the bars, shoot pool, or just listen to music. True golfers already know it's more for entertainment and not "real" golf. I mean, it's not a driving range or golf course. You don't score points the same way as Tee Time.   It's great for golfers and non-golfers. However, the wait time is way too long! They estimated 4 hours for our group so we left, had fun somewhere else, then came back and still waited another hour! There has got to be a better estimating system. The staff were friendly. They recommend that we come in the morning when it's not busy.   Our waitress Vanessa was very nice. Food was good enough to eat. Drinks were decent as well. If you're looking for a fun place to enjoy with friends and family, or kids even, we feel that this Topgolf is a great addition to Charlotte. It's new right now, so it's super busy. Parking can be a pain too. So we will wait until it dies down to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

-anEjbN6ZInQeL8G6IdfLQ.text: I had heard so much about TopGolf from friends in Atlanta that I could not wait for the Charlotte location to open. Simply put, it's a bowling alley for golfing. You can go and golf, you can go and drink, or you can go and do both!   I went a couple weeks back with a group of about 12 guys the day before my wedding. We had to wait about an hour for a bay, but fortunately there is a full bar at your disposal while you wait.   If it is your first time, you have to buy a membership ($5) and anyone that wants to golf is required to have one as well. The wait at the bar for a drink can be extensive, but of course that is due to the high volume of people, not necessarily the quality of the service.  Once the novelty wears off and the crowds thin out, I'm looking forward to going back!

_x2jnRTbtDI7t7s-ILU1zw.text: I had a departmental team building event recently where catering, adult beverages and a smaller group played. The process was very easy, the staff that I coordinated with via email and in person were all very helpful. I will say that I was slightly disappointed with the food package we had ordered. We thought it would be best to have the food ready in advance but for a group of 12, I should have let everyone order what they wanted. Larger groups, I would definitely recommend pre-ordering but they should come up with better food packages. The game itself I am at a disadvantage because my hand-eye coordination is terrible! I tried and that is what counts, not to mention, I really did have fun. Great for groups, great for team building, highly recommend overall.

10DAl9c5hMh_nuuug2eZ-Q.text: The wait wasn't too bad, about 30 minutes.  Food was prompt, drinks were cold, no complaints other than beer is way too expensive :)

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled apple sandwich and watermelon dots.  Refreshing and filling!

aqi69EwpoHCwy0GGMurhJw.text: I was thrilled to attend the VIP opening party and have a chance to play at the new Charlotte facility. I am a major fan of TopGolf (having played in other cities), so there are no words for me to explain my excitement for now being in my city. If you're looking for a fun, outdoor activity with friends, this is a great choice. It's great for all weather because you're mostly inside. There is A/C if it's hot out and heat if it's cold. Don't worry about being a good golfer - there are lots of games to choose from. You don't need to hit the ball far to win; just be consistent.   They also have great food and drinks, so it makes for an awesome brunch, lunch, or dinner. Absolutely in love with this place!

G_z-db6ysnv-PgGe9qosAw.text: They seem to always have wait, we arrived at 11a and were told there was a 30 minute wait. The wait must have been longer as the line was almost out the door as we left 2.5 hours later.  We had fun and it was a good experience. Nice atmosphere to hang out and hit some golf balls.

3LqGwJjkMCt1xpNBGurg-Q.text: I came for my birthday. Their  was a mix-up with credits on my membership account but was able to still let us play the bay .Overall it was a good experience.  Surprisingly it was packed on a Wednesday night like really packed. There was a 2 1/2 hour wait for a bay but we had planned on eating anyways so that wasn't an issue. The food and drink menu is varied and everyone was able to order to their liking. I will not I ordered a corona-rita and my waitress said they didn't have one which is weird.  Pros: Menu, music,staff, bay reservation alert via text Cons: Parking- I don't understand why more parking wasn't planned.  The process for getting your physical membership card in one line then getting in another to reserve a bay; process was not smooth and definitely needs to be improved especially when busy.   Tips: Definitely carpool or Uber if possible. go with the intention to eat so the possible 2-hour wait doesn't seem so shocking

H-2WpiWpzkG4P1lmzwBABg.text: Very nice establishment. Drinks, food, music, service and everything was perfect. We didn't have a wait on a busy Friday night. I went with a party of 4 and there was more than enough room on the bay. Although I mostly drank, ate and mingled while the others played, I was still entertained and engaged. The outside temperature was between 36-40 degrees and it was raining lightly during our 2 hour stay but Top Golf does a great job of regulating the temperature to keep guests comfortable even though wind gusts can bring a chill every now and then. Overall, I would recommend Top Golf for a great night out with friends. We will be back again when we come back home to Charlotte for Christmas.

VLEMObyhg80rQpVYsyccsw.text: Great place for an outing. It has TopGolf and a great bar/restaurant. It was great to be able to order while playing Topgolf and eat between turns. Great food, great fun. Thoroughly enjoyable. Will definitely return soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

vuBO2Zkz60zEyi1zNE3UCw.text: The salad there was surprisingly good and the portion size was very generous. Although I didn't get everything on the menu said that the item would have the taste was good enough that I was able to overlook it. The chicken waffles was also okay, it was mediocre and nothing out of the ordinary. The best thing on the menu that I saw my friend  order, would be the steak cheese sandwich. This place is pretty good about having finger food because it's perfect when you're playing topgolf.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles

T8K1tgx4SOCTimOOkIZCYA.text: Main problem- unsupervised children next to us. 6 to 8 boys ages 8-10 maybe. Throwing golf balls at the carts below and even clubs. Pushing shoving each other on the edge of the putting area, screaming and jumping all over the furniture.  ( 2nd floor) I told two different employees and nothing was done. The wait for food and drinks was ridiculous. I understand they were somewhat busy but it was a Friday night and I think they should've been prepared for it. The actual golf experience would've have been much better without the unruly unsupervised children.Super disappointed. Found at the parents were in the main bar area ... employees were sent down to " watch " them.

4Xw8EZ70RUM_id8Xrtx20g.text: Took my husband out for his birthday it's was a good experience but kinda pricey... I pay $80 just for 2 person. We brought one appetizer and two beer. Stay there for only one hour cause they charge per hours. Its was like $32 or $37 an hour I think, don't remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Its was okay I think I pay $12 for this.

ZSl_O0JZGT2NaHm3fC0Udg.text: The greatest new thing in Charlotte! You don't have to be a golfer to come! It's fun for all! We had a short wait when we arrived and decided to get a drink. Before we ordered we received our text saying our bay was ready so we walked away to wait. It took like 15 more minutes to get the text with our bay number. I just wish when you got the text saying "it's ready-close out your bar tab" it was actually time.   Once we got to our bay we were greeted and given directions. Even after directions it definitely helps if you go with someone whose been there before. It is fairly simple though! You have a server who can bring you food and drinks, a computer at your bay to choose your games and a tv to watch whatever you want. The seating is very comfortable and I love the couch setup.   It's really easy to keep adding time to your golfing so have a plan before you go in on how long you want to stay/ how much you want to pay

7RCl52xTZHJNdmXlrR4lEA.text: This was my 1st and last visit to this restaurant. The entire service sucked, it was horrible, it took 3hrs to received our food , the food was cold, when we finally received it.. We spoke with managers , it didn't seen to make a difference.. We were there trying to celebrate a veteran birthday. The service was so bad and this was a horrific experience. I will not recommend this place  to any of my associates, friends, or family.  We did observed another customer complaining about horrible service, when we arrive, the waitress and some more staff members actually laugh at her.. terrible

Mr1Tc0-Aun-Mm0VPUcObvA.text: Top Golf is a fun hangout even if you don't get a bay. We hung out at the bar and watched the game. The bartenders were attentive and pleasant. We went to play golf and I wish they had a system to check in and be on a waiting list in order to avoid getting back in line to find out they're still out of available bays. There was plenty of parking and people were quite friendly. So be Frank this is a spot to head out with friends but not a date night spur of the moment. We enjoyed our visit but we felt it could've been soooo much better. Not bad but not great.

HjWWGrNTWCLqyHggZXwJhQ.text: The food is very good but when golfing, the scores get messed up a lot and it's annoying. I fall far behind because it keeps not giving me what I scored

XKPKS5hDTBeEVmmX1Vg3Aw.text: Fun time for the whole family!  We purchased the VIP package for my daughter's birthday on a Saturday afternoon.  We were a party of 6 with only one legit golfer amongst us and everyone was able to play and have fun!  Good service. Check in was a little confusing. We would definitely try again!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

iADKZRDmtgk-aGic1B6wIw.text: It will be a long time before I visit the Charlotte TopGolf again.  I've been there 5 times.  3 of the 5 times, I couldn't get in because there was an event.  The last 2 times, I checked the web site and tried to call first.  The web site gave no warning, and there was no answer when I tried to call.  Having a way to tell whether they are open or not would get them a 4 star from me.  Driving 20 minutes to find out whether they are open is not in my plan.  If they are open, the experience is really cool.  The concept is fantastic.  The game is fun for all skill levels and its a great place to just hang out.    Cocktails are weak and expensive, but the food is very good.    If I could tell whether or not they were open without driving to the facility, I would come here a lot.

DJfF1Dai7O96m3j1Hs4zfw.text: Who doesn't love this place ... only problem is the parking and the wait. I mean 2-3 hrs at times. Luckily the food can compensate to a degree. The food is really really good. Golfing is so fun especially after a couple drinks. The atmosphere is what makes it all the more exciting the lights and competing against friends. It was packed and our waiter kinda left us hanging at times other than that it's always fun at top golf

3yw2vfVfJ44TYLopWvc02Q.text: Came here to join the Saints watch party. I believe they hold other teams here as well but I don't really care about them lol. Plenty of seating and they two servers  for a party and they were very attentive. I ordered an angry orchard draft and cheese fries just as a snack to watch the game. They have three huge screens to enjoy the game. My only complaint would be the freezing AC. It's one of the first cooler days so the AC only adds to how cold it is. Had to back to get my jacket. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two of the three big screens in this area

aOhpn-hey8LIwbjwFceYlg.text: I love going to TopGolf and I love the concept. However this was my first time at the Charlotte location. We arrived later in the night, so I expected it to be packed. I was happy the wait wasn't long because the early evening crowd was exiting as we walked inside. While waiting for our booth, we decided have drinks downstairs. The floor on the ground level was very slippery, as if it was mopped with oily water. The waitress was very nice and we received our drinks pretty quickly.   We were told that we'd get 2 text messages before we were seated. The first text came through telling us to close any tabs and we would be seated soon. However, "soon" turned into 45-50 min. After finally receiving the second text, we went to our booth only to be turned around by the staff because they "put us at another booth". We waited.....again. I decided to go to the front to inquie about any problems. I was told our booth will be ready "soon". After being there for 2 hours, we decided to leave. If it wasn't for having a few drinks and the atmosphere, this would be a 1 star review due to service.

-iDA_Z9MR-x3IqXrsc3kEw.text: We arrived at Topgolf at 11 am on a rainy Saturday. The place was busy, and they were on an hour wait. There was plenty to do while we waited - pool, eating and drinking, walking around the place, and more. The hour passed quickly, and we were soon taken to our bay. We were checked in by a helpful employee who explained the concept, and quickly got to playing. Our group of 4 played for 1.5 hours (which was the right amount of time), and we had a great time.  Some things to know: -Wear anything - flip flops, heels, sneakers, etc. -Bring your own clubs or use theirs (for free) -Great way to spend time as a group of friends, couple, or family (if a family go earlier in the day as this place becomes a party scene as it gets later in the day) -You can eat and drink here - they have a variety of food though I've heard the food is just average -They have clean restrooms -Pricing is by the hour by the bay (up to 6 people per bay). -Prices escalate as the day goes on - I believe $25 an hour per bay until the noon, then $35 from noon to 4pm, and then $45 the rest of the day

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

q8eLhOxd23cdK88I-X_rCg.text: We came here as a group of 6 for the New Year's Day half off special. It was a great deal after we split everything. Very cool concept and a fun place to hang out with friends. The service was great. This place is very popular and wait times can be very long though.

Nxr9z6wELqcTTd6XKbQSGA.text: Great place to develop your golf skills and have laughs.  Just be prepared that it can be costly

n7kDTYRqw_91spfqlvD-Og.text: In general I think this was a genius concept. It combines the ability to practice a leisure sport without having to be good at it (this would definitely be me), while eating food, enjoying beverages and having a good time with friends. The food is no 5 star restaurant, but it's not bad! Recommend the giant pretzel charcuterie.   There can be a wait here because it has been so popular, especially on a nice weekend day.  Don't let chilly weather keep you away either - every slot has a heater that you can set to your liking! Kept me warm enough on a 45-50 degree evening that I didn't need to wear my coat.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Giant Pretzel charcuterie

12zrS41-rOiXsphdCq_ohw.text: The experience itself was fun but our server wasn't knowledgeable on their vegan options. She wasn't willing to check unless we asked. They were out of the impossible burger, which is probably not their fault, but still sucked since that was one of the main reasons we went. We asked her if the veggie burger was vegan and she said yes. I asked her to double check since she seemed unsure and she came back and let us know it had milk and eggs. That being said she was about to serve us the burger not being sure it was vegan and I personally am highly lactose intolerant. We ordered guacamole, fries and hummus and it took a very long time. I would go again but I would call ahead and make sure they have the burger and probably get a different server. I would hope that they properly inform their staff on allergens like this.

EvRL2P_RRmyNtcFQdZF1OQ.text: Terrence is AMAZING. Great location outside the city, so you're able to avoid traffic. Three levels, great service. Alcohol is reasonably priced. Prices are half off on Tuesdays! Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

XXwbpDsFTLd_EHDFU3Y1wQ.text: We went for work function in a large group taking up several bays. The drinks were great. The food was so much better than I ever expected it to be! It was so much fun and we'll be back with friends. You don't need to know anything about goal. (I'm both uncoordinated, left-handed and not particularly athletic and still did well and had a blast.

kmhOirrgW5f_hhInnXyeJg.text: Woo Topgolf!  Finally got to see what everyone was talking about and took my office... yes, I'm the most senior person in the office now, for an outing.  Staff was super-friendly and this was before the Christmas/Holiday season so there were a bunch of businesses doing their holiday parties here the night we chose to go.  It was Wednesday afternoon.... we were coming from Uptown so I-77 traffic during rush hour was horrible, but upon arriving, it was like coming up from an oasis.... I was probably just happy to get out of the car by then.  It was cold, but the bay we were assigned (like all the bays) have heaters that were on timers... the server showed us how to use them (**important tip**) and we were good for the rest of our stay... I even had to shed some layers after we did a little "speed" round of hitting.  Menu was pretty extensive and our server kept checking on drinks and food.  I ended up getting the spinach salad (added chicken) and also order appetizers for the booth.  Chips and beer cheese were solid and the wings, though messy, were great as well.  Staff also gave us a run through of how the set-up works and safety about where to stand... I can see where it can get a little crazy with larger parties, but it was a fun outing and I was just happy I could hit the ball.

CK2ZF57-rwHvQ1XqTNB3bw.text: We always have a great time here and after visiting the Edison NJ location, we were so glad that we would finally get a Topgolf near our new home. We have so much fun with the different games because none of us can play golf if our lives depended on it. The drinks are good, the food is good. The only thing I would say is that with the set up of their service, I would order and eat inside or outside. The people that serve inside at the bar get ripped off in tips when people transfer their tab outside. I don't think that is fair since we did the majority of our ordering, eating inside. Once you get outside, make sure they give you silverware. I don't know why but they never seem to remember to give us silverware.

0dwDH5ARrp9m6WtRxQzU3A.text: I had no idea what to expect when coming here, but I has a blast! No matter you skill level, the atmosphere makes for a great night with drinks that are deliverd right to your bay! It was snowing when we went but still super warm at our table, which made it a really cool experience.

hEa2tuPUQ0eVxQAFUHSqSw.text: I am rating this place purely in the golfing because the food and drinks are bar options. It meets the standard. However, I don't understand why every time you go here they tell you it's a 2 hour wait. I have attempted to go here multiple times to see at least 10 bays open but a magical "2 hour wait" this is completely absurd. And none of the staff can answer why the bays are open. I've been to other Top Golfs and have never had this experience. Charlotte needs to get it together if I'm ever going to return to this location. Seems like a stupid ploy to get money from people at the bar. Once you actually get to golf the experience is fun. That's only if you'll sit around for 2 hours. I avisited at 4pm on a Friday, I'd hate to see what the wait was like during "prime time"

W77bGXiXRrIUuuaUkYaMWg.text: Great food. Great sport. Great everything. Highly recommend going to this place. They also have free pool and foosball down stairs. Everything on the menu was also fresh and excellent

nctcJ7w6WbHKcKbCJUHemw.text: Staff was rude at the bay. Rushed us out by taking our drinks before we were finished. Wouldnt finish letting us hit the balls dispensed during our hour. Very disappointed in the service. Doesnt compare to other Top Golf facilities. Oh and there are no stadium lights to see your ball after dark and no pro tracer either.

ZIDNI0NWgZ5PfI4klZz12Q.text: The concept is great.  The hostesses in the front were very upbeat and polite.  We had a nice time playing golf for an hour.  Our waitress in the golf bay was very "low-key", almost like she was bored to death.  After our golf game, we went to the restaurant, and were pleased to see it wasn't crowded.  It took WAY too long for anyone to come over, and when someone did come we were told they would go get someone else.  WTW?  Guess who came to wait on us?  The same "bored to death" waitress we had previously.  On a scale of 1 - 10, her customer service skills are MAYBE a 1.  Thank you for helping us celebrate our son's Birthday!  You had more "energy" when you were chatting with your friends at another table.  So much so I had to go over and tap  her on the shoulder to let her know we were ready to pay.  Worst service ever, Andrea P.!

3wlkUPOA1bzvdhHfuVYUXQ.text: Top golf has a unique gimmick, that really helps it stand in the ever expanding world of bars/restaurants. The game alone is a reason to come here, but on top of that it has pretty good food as well, a rare find in gimmicky restaurants such as this. The food is overall pretty solid, but I wouldn't call it incredible or anything. Overall, it gets 4 stars on the merit of the fun game you get to play as you eat.

Vm-TKrR0e1_II8_CK5Py6w.text: Every time we go we have a great time. It's fun whether your an avid golfer or have never picked up a club. You will have a blast. The servers are great and the food is really good , especially for bar food. Can't wait to go back!

qf7xG0_ZZi-QWtCdBGMmKg.text: This place is pretty awesome!! I mean the music, the food, the environment, the golf ....all great!!! Cant wait to bring the whole fam!!

1JOPfbh2P6g5wuJ9ZibGAQ.text: I would give 5 stars but we tried to go on opening night after calling and hearing there was no wait. Once we got there, the line for membership (which you need to play) was out the door, down the stairs and into the parking lot. That was incredibly annoying. Not only would we have to wait for membership but once we had membership we would have had to wait for an open bay, not a no wait situation. We went back around lunch time during the week and it was great. We had a great time and will definitely be back now that we don't have to wait for membership. The food was very good and it was fun to golf in a casual setting.

rAPqPpynHqU-EBezxzK3jA.text: If you're coming to Topgolf be prepared to wait at least 45 minutes to an hour. We went straight to the bar. There was about 3 bartenders & they walked past us about 3 times. We ordered our drinks, the margarita was good. It had the right amount of alcohol but a little too sweet for my taste. We also ordered the Mushi which was actually pretty good. A bit spicy so be prepared. We didn't receive any extra plates with our appetizers but we used napkins (also didn't provide utensils; would have been nice considering the meat was falling out.) Not the best service but a lot of people seem to come here. Would still come again because it's something to do in Charlotte.

LShqFpC3Ra4zWh7VjuiNpA.text: Arrived here and it took an hour to get seated after they told us a 20 minute wait. We received our text to be seated, but our bay was occupied when we arrived and the table needed to be bused. Another 10 mins later, we finally got seated. Another 15 minutes until an overwhelmed server came to take our orders. Queue another 30 minute wait for our drinks. Food finally came, which was on par with a chuckie cheese, not good, and twice as expensive. This whole time I was asked repeatedly for my ID, membership cards, and credit card, which was seriously annoying after the 10th time. I will stick to my local driving ranges, and advise anyone thinking about going here to lower there expectations dramatically.

jDfLfWufl3xdhlv9coCLLg.text: This place is great! The food is very good. The venue and general concept is great. I have to take two stars off fir the service. Service was AWFUL. The bartenders don't even look up. They can't do more than one task at a time & still manage to forget the fruit garnish. This place could be a gold mine. The owners & mgrs need to look up & watch Rehab; Party @ the Hard Rock. It was a reality show a few years back. They knew how to run a place this size. Hope they get it together.

Z0uQhjZF-lpZaEnFKeZaFg.text: After visiting another Top golf location I was a little disappointed with this one.   The venue is extremely nice I must say, but the prices are a bit much. I guess I was expecting the same price range at this location but apparently each one is different. None the less of you're looking for a good date night just look forward to a pricey time. Being that the location I visited before was up north I was a little surprised with the cost of play and other things here in Charlotte ( I get it, you're paying for the experience but come on). Northern VA top golf charges by the game and you get a certain amount of balls with each game (great idea, doesn't keep you on a time limit and it's cost effective, you also don't mind spending more on other things). To keep in mind everyone will not travel in groups to a place like this, just like bowling etc. So the fees per hr to go to a "driving range" sounds a little excessive.   I hope as time goes on they will get a little a better. Not sure what audience they are trying to target but I'm currently not a fan of this particular location (just on pricing alone).

3PlqkCQfZwKy9Juie-SbWg.text: I'm not even an avid golfer - or golfer at all. In fact, even put put frustrates me. However, I LOVED playing here. We had a very long wait to play, so we decided to eat while we waited. Surprisingly, the food was EXCELLENT. It took quite some time to get our food, but we were there during their busiest time - Saturday night. The food and drinks ARE pricey, but everything is delicious. Overall, great food, great fun, great time. Smaller children would have a TOUGH time waiting, but it's an excellent outing for young adults and up. We'll definitely be back.

XNnL7MNvTkikiEJ01r-ixQ.text: Once we got to actually play, things got better. The game is fun and we had better access to service. The start of the experience wasn't so great. At the inside bar where you wait for your game, we waited 10 minutes for a server and 20 minutes for our drinks, which finally came after 3 visits to ask for them and a manager swing by. In the end we had fun, just expect service inside to be subpar and much better outside.

MxaxSxfB6BprH4jERXefMg.text: Fun fun fun!   What a great idea and fun place to have a party.  I will make this trip up from Columbia many more times!   Better than real golf.  Great music too.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

BLdStMga-IsbahQwVNGBAg.text: The game is fun even for people who have no experience. Price for the games are reasonable. Food is a little over priced and drinks definitely overpriced but that is typical for this type of venue. My only complaint is the music is very specific for certain types of people. Definitely not the type of music men would enjoy/ my husband and all my friends husbands were complaining ! It is really loud booty music and you feel like you are in an uptown charlotte booty club! We also hosted our company party here in December it was a good time and the employees enjoyed it ! We have a staff of mostly women though- I'm not sure how the male corporate world would respond to the music blasted here !

3Mg9DUrbGqcVu1P5Ks4tLw.text: They really need to get their customer service together!!!! They weren't friendly or helpful at all, & very rude

_XNRLc_EmjlL5_cIs7JGGQ.text: We're not golfers but my son has picked it up recently so we decided to stop in Topgolf and check it out. We had a great time and can't wait to go back.

4fIbw8lJOTgqqrPnlSyuVg.text: Gotta say that despite a few initial hiccups., Pat the Operations Manager got everything squared away.  They actually focused on solid customer service!  I'd recommend this location for that very reason.

AAWGzNrcyngDdq1Z5efS4w.text: For what topgolf is I never would have expected the food to be as good as it was. Beyond impressed. Their Bloody Mary was delicious, oh and the golf aspect is really fun. My husband is the golfer. I went just to wack balls haha. It was great and the price is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

VqzeWu2vJu-qdLGdcK4cgg.text: We have been 3 times since Top Golf has opened. It has gotten me to love the sport and we have had a blast. The food is fantastic and the drinks are good too. All three times we have been we knew there would be a significant wait time so we planned ahead and decided to do dinner. We have yet to be disappointed. Even with a three hour wait at one point we ended up golfing until close. It is such a neat facility and they have done a great job building an experience. Our waiter, Sean Switzer has been great both times we have had him and always try to sit in his section if we see him at the bar. This place is a blast, I highly recommend it for a date night as long as you are prepared for the long wait! If you are looking for something quick this is not the place!

n4MYabHNKBIAAt0FHNa8jw.text: This is an incredibly fun outing but unfortunately the Food and Beverage management is very weak.   Terribly understaffed for the volume of business that they do leads to a ton of waiting and poor service.

zUiowDBufGAlp3HZ19VI2g.text: How cool is this place!!!  I was lucky enough to score an invite to the sneak peak event last night, and it was every bit as awesome as it looks online. If you want to know what this place is all about, visit their website and watch the 2 minute video as it provides a great orientation for what TopGolf is all about.   As an avid golfer, I was really looking forward to visiting this facility. I learned quickly this place is NOT just a place for golfers. It caters to players of all skill levels and ages. You don't even have to pick up a club to have an awesome outing at this place.   The Facilities: *Hole in One! The first thing that strikes you is the enormity of the complex - from the height of the nets, to the size of the building and parking lot. Inside everything is very clean and modern, from the seating, to the bar, the private rooms, and the bays themselves.   The Food and Drinks: *Birdie This place has the potential to be like Dave and Busters for grown-ups with better food. Here are the items I sampled:  Mini Potato Skins - *Albatross - By far the best executed of food items. I could eat these every day.  Mushie - A Strong Birdie - Could have used slightly less cilantro.  Seared Scallop - Birdie - Would have been an eagle with a little more aggressive seasoning. Lemon Butter Broccolini - Birdie - Very nice side dish with shaved garlic citrus infused butter. Vibrant and flavorful. Shrimp Cocktail - Par - Would have been a birdie if all of the shrimp had been fully cooked. The cocktail sauce with diced avocado was among the best I've had.  Tipsy Palmer - Bogey - I've had better John Daly's. This version fell flat, lacking enough lemon flavor. Would have also benefited from a splash of tonic or sprite.  Smoked Prime Rib - *Bogey - This sounded so promising, but unfortunately it was a miss. I'm guessing this was smoked at too high a temp for not long enough as the fat and collagen had not properly rendered into the meat which left it tough, chewy, and unpalatable.    The Equipment: *Par Each bay is equipped with male and female right handed clubs. Left handed clubs are available on request or you can also bring your own equipment. The irons had the look and feel of super game improvement Callaway clubs with with the TopGolf logos in place of regular branding. Each club had graphite shafts, the men's felt more stiff that a typical regular flex but not as firm as typical stiff shafts. The irons are more than adequate, but the woods seemed to be quite dated - the driver looking exactly like a mid-90s Big Bertha in size and design. Overall, the irons were easy to hit for players of any skill level, but the woods will present challenges to even some mid to low handicappers.   The Mats: *Bogey For me this was the most disappointing feature. For a brand new facility, I would have expected mats that had variable lie conditions - firm sections for fairway strikes, and softer longer cut turf to practice softer lies. Additionally, the tees were not adjustable. IMO, they were too high for iron shots, just right for the 3 wood, and too low for driver. They also lacked the ability to hold a standard tee as they we hollow inside. This will likely not bother a novice looking to have a good time, but golfers who join looking to use this as a practice supplement will be frustrated by these items.   The Games: *Eagle These were pretty cool. There is a wide variety of different games to choose from. Some are individual while some are team based. The traditional TopGolf game awards points for shots on target, with more points awarded the closer you come to the pin. Think darts with golf balls. Much like a bowling alley, you have a screen where you can type in player info, and select the game you wish to play. Players grab a club and head to the mat where they wave the club over a laser, which triggers a ball to be released. After each shot your score is tabulated and you can switch players by selecting them on the touch screen. There are also games for chipping, driving, and other skill challenges.     The Cost: *Par (but not one you feel good about) Bays are rented by the hour and the cost variable based on the time of day. All players are required to sign up for an initial one-time $5 membership. After that, Bay rentals are as follows: Open til Noon = $25 | Noon til 5 PM = $35 | 5 PM til Close = $45. This can be steep if you are playing solo, but if you are in a group of 6, it is much more palatable. The bay rental comes with unlimited balls during your time period.

WNnl02L06XZyM1fRz4V-qQ.text: We had a group of 6 people: upon arriving we were greeted and told to wait which is fine. We went to the bar and ordered some drinks while we waited. The beers were fine and so was the gin and tonic but the plain margarita tasted of salt water and had zero hint of tequila. When I told the waitress it was quite frankly disgusting she said "okay". The flavored ones my friends had ordered tasted fine. Once we sat down service was fun and relatively quick given how busy they were but after racking up a near 300$ tab we were enjoying the end of our chips and a good night when we were told to leave our table.  We politely left and sat at the bar where another waitress came up and asked us if we were "ordering or hanging out" and then walked away without saying anything when we said we didn't need anything else. All in all I'd say a good experience but the business gave me the sense of money hungry rather than entertainment minded. The mandatory 5$ membership is kinda dumb if you'll only go once, especially if you're from out of town and don't have one in your home town.

vrDheecGCzPW2rCUn1AkFA.text: Think driving range on steroids! This place is amazing and such a great time for all ages. Whether you're having a party with friends or a night out with the family, this place is great. The food is sneaky good, the atmosphere is excellent, staff is friendly, and that's before you even get into the golf. Whether you're a PGA pro or have never swung a club, you can have a great time here. They have multiple games and a ton of options for all skill levels. I took private lessons and highly recommend them. If in Charlotte, request Billy Belair, he's an insanely good golfer and even better instructor

9zhduqlhUgPvqSXOLuPh2Q.text: Really fun!  Long line to get in, but once we paid, we were very quickly taken to a bay.   Our server was excellent, as was every employee was encountered. We only ordered an appetizer, and it was delivered right away and was good.   For us, it was pricy fun because it was just us - so no one to help split the hourly bay charges. And since we only had an hour to fit in the golf and snacking, it wasn't necessarily relaxing. However, if you go with another couple or with a few friends, you could easily spend a few hours and have time to play and eat and split the cost and it wouldn't be that expensive.

SvCq3NnrI9Mn_z7V4Ym4fg.text: It was my first time ever going to a place like this. I went with a really big group and we had two sections. I really did not enjoy the gold part because I really suck at golf and the guys in my group were making fun of me. So I decided to just go watch the game on tv at the bar. I made a really great friend with the bartender. I believe her name is Kayla. She was so sweet and entertaining and really made a crummy night better. I hope next time I go she is there. Kayla I wish you the best of luck with your life plan great things ahead for you !!

HKA8D1_AdKendFK1D7pw3g.text: What a fantastic time!  A couple of things...if you show up on the weekend without a reservation, be prepared to wait awhile--its packed!  However, the good news is, you can reserve your spot well ahead of time and it really does make the process super easy.  The price, when split among a group of 6 or more for playing time is honestly VERY reasonable.  The food is pretty good as well.  I can't comment on the drinks, but others in my group seemed to be enjoying theirs.  HIGHLY recommend this place!!!

nDdxg7V_tu77jPks7oscBQ.text: Finally made it here on July 3rd around 7:30. Parking was a nightmare, we were finally able to nag a spot after a long time searching. We bought our membership cards online and put our name in without much hassle. We were quoted 2.5-3 hours but it ended up being less than 2. While we waited we went to the main floor bar. Service was difficult. After greeting us he took my husband's drink order and ran away without getting mine. One friend had to wait nearly an hour for a drink. We had to flag down the waiter to get napkins. The wait staff needs some practice and numerous addition servers, everyone looked frantic. The actual gameplay was really fun! I'm not a golf person and I had a great time. The service at the table was great. I'm so glad this place opened!

LhJmWjULblVP25lvGFmgbA.text: Good concept but Oh my god the service is very very bad, we had to ask to get a waiter to take care of us after being seated for 10min. Anyway go have fun with drinks and golf but don't eat.

wmlU76N9PYs8UO1O7yC5pQ.text: Golf was fun. Waitresses jumbling up the bill wasn't. Somehow a $29 bill in my hand turned into a $45 bill after my card was swiped (2 beers and 1/6 of 2.5hrs of Topgolf). Disorganized and obviously 150% more expensive that the original bill states...

oXubXZt8jAh2zK1zqhaFaw.text: This was my 2nd visit to Topgolf, The first visit I left without eating or playing. We had a 2.5 hour wait time, so we decided to eat while waiting. oPhflC850kjmKUBTONFrBA.text: Cool space to come on a date or with friends/family for some fun. Even if you suck at golf like me, aiming for the giant targets and getting point is still a thrill!  Minus 1 star for the initial confusing nature of getting a reservation and waiting(we tried to make a reservation, and the only way to do it is online or using the app, if you have any questions at the counter, the staff seemed a bit ill equipped to help). Also, you have to pay $5 to become a lifetime member($4 if you pay through the app)? Why not just have to pay the range fee and that's it? The membership is almost completely worthless except you now can receive promotional emails and track your stats.  That being said, once that was taken care of, the game itself is super fun, and getting food brought to your Bay is a breeze, and the prices extremely reasonable!  Now since I'm a member for life, I guess I'll be back again to have some fun!

-AKxK0p5Ty-7CgYci0hXiw.text: My husband and friends came to visit Charlotte from GA and were super excited about trying something new, so we came to top golf WOW super fun atmosphere, food was awesome ! At least my backyard wings were !! Waitress was awesome! Super informative on menu and gave some awesome tips for our swing  My only problem was the annoying fans that kept blowing my hair everywhere and made my food cold.. also that 5$ fee for first timers was kinda a buzz kill but we had fun over all.   Also I recommend the Moscow mule

au5E5CkPli66jzXHqEImDA.text: First time at TopGolf Charlotte! I've been to the first one in Alexandria, VA a million times so I figured this to be a better, upgraded version of TopGolf. It definitely was. Although I did have some initial trouble transferring over the funds of my Alexandria TopGolf card to my new Charlotte one, the staff was SUPER helpful and Jenn the manager took care of me to make it pain free! SHOUTOUT TO JENN.  Like I said, this location is pretty much a 'roided up version of the one I'm used to. There are three levels, updated bays that spit out golf balls when you wave your club over a light, and a ton of different games to play. The targets and turf we were hitting at you could also tell were in good shape and were KEPT in good shape.   My only criticism with the golfing experience was that sometimes it seemed like the screen would bounce it back and forth between players, making us hit each others balls (not a huge deal), and also there was no lighting past the bays when hitting. If you hit it out to the white target or back to the net, there was pretty much no way to see your ball unless you have hawk eyes.  I didn't get any food on my first visit, but the menu was pretty extensive. Both the drink and the food menu have a pretty nice variety! Some really tasty looking stuff that I'll have to try when I get back.  We all know what TopGolf is so if you're wondering if this is a good location, yes. Yes it is. It's relatively cheap and since they have 3 levels of bays, you can expect to not wait too long until you get to make fun of your friends for being horrible at golf. Fun had by all.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lit up Top Golf

z44YvLofi_qAzSHtKcIXuA.text: I've been to Top Golf twice since moving to Charlotte. It can get a little expensive - especially if you're having food or drinks - but you can usually find a coupon online for the games. The building is huge and every time I've been here it's been pretty crowded. When you get here there are usually a couple of employees there to greet you and guide you through the process.   The first I came here was in January - while they do have heaters my fiance and I were still pretty cold while playing. We ordered one of their coffee cocktails and it was pretty good and warmed us up a bit. We weren't very good so we just played the most basic game - but we had a lot of fun!   The second time I was here my fiance and I brought my dad for father's day. It was pretty warm out, but the fans kept us cool. We ordered the hummus to snack on and it was alright. Again - we just played the basic game - nothing fancy. But we had a great time! My dad loved it!   Top Golf is definitely something I won't do on a regular basis just because it can get expensive, but it's great for celebrations, groups, or a date night.

gLiB8lheTcq7RWBJq27Uew.text: After trying to come here the day after a holiday and being turned down as it was packed.. I was pleasantly surprised at how much fun I had the second time around.   It helps to sign up on the app for $4.. it is mandatory to sign up either in person or online.. and once you do.. you're a lifetime member. Pricing varies on time of day. $25/hr per bay up til noon and up to $45/hr at night time.. so split that between a group of up to 6 people and it's not too expensive.   My group of 4 stopped in on a Friday and had a short 15 minute wait for our bay in the 3rd flood. Everything runs smoothly here.. everything is tracked and scored for you.. even recorded in the app you signed up on.   Top golf offers food from breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drinks.. all fairly priced. I tried the jalapeno cheese fries which were delicious.   Overall a great experience. It's kid and family friendly as well as a great date spot. Will definitely try top golf facilities in other parts of the country!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

Jb-f4Xlwn-C2e1DAbM_L0Q.text: Fun, fun, fun! Whether you're an avid golfer or a novice, Top Golf offers lots of fun.   We had visited a different location and were excited when one close to home opened. What a perfect way to spend Mother's Day for me! We arrived early and I would advise you to do so on any given weekend day. It gets PACKED quickly.   Check in to get your card and assigned to a bay. We like being on upper levels for the better views.   In your bay, you can order from a pretty lengthy menu with lots of drink and food options. Today, we chose drinks and filled-doughnuts. Everything was great. I love that you have a server for your bay. Ours was extremely attentive!  Great family outing. A tad expensive but worth the hours of fun playing various games in our competitive family!   One tip: bring your own clubs if you have them. I think I would have enjoyed it a tad more using my own clubs for comfort.

Lots of music to keep the party going and if you're worried about being cold when it gets dark then they've got you covered. AIputdWz_Kd2Gn2ivffmlQ.text: I am not a golfer. Not even a mini golfer. But Topgolf sounded fun, so we decided to check it out recently. We went on a Sunday around 2 & there was a 30 minute wait for the 2nd or 3rd level - no wait for the first level. We put our names down and headed to the bar for a beer while we waited. Our bay was ready on time (they text you to let you know) and we met our bay host there. She helped us get set up and showed us how the game worked. You can choose from a bunch of different pre-set games, each game is 20 balls. We only wanted to play for an hour and were able to squeeze in 3 games (the last game we really rushed).   There were a lot of pro golfers, but plenty of non-golfers like us. Overall we had a lot of fun, but it's a little pricey for me to do very often. Hopefully they will start running promos once the buzz dies down!  Here are a couple of basics for people who haven't checked it out yet: * Each person needs a $5 lifetime membership (one-time cost) * The price is per hour - 6 people can play in a bay * The price differs by time: Open - Noon is $25, Noon - 5 is $35 and after 5 is $45 * You can make reservations online, but on the weekend the fee is $10 - $50 (looks like no fee for weekday reservs) * You have a server at your bay and they have a pretty big food and drink menu - we didn't try the food, but beer prices were pretty reasonable

MxeHUZTK3NG7sd7Sgz3rqA.text: Topgolf is a very fun experience. It can be enjoyed by people who regularly play golf and by those who have never swung a golf club. The venue is nice, clean, and up to date. The bays are spacious with high top seating or couch options. They have heaters for when it is colder outside. The food was really good and they had a nice selection. Drinks were good here too. It is a bit on the pricier side but as long as I am having a good experience and getting what I paid for I am okay with shelling out some money every now and again.

hFpe2_7bxthbJOWaISWj0A.text: Had a friend outing here over the weekend. Overall, had a great experience. The game play was great, no issues at all. We had everything we needed and the lane availability was fantastic. The food that we ordered was good. One in our party had some dietary restrictions and the staff was not very helpful in accommodating her, so we ended up looking for food again after. Had the service been a little better, we could have probably stayed a lot longer. Will definitely go visit again.

48BUz1barsgvOGBEFWr1Ng.text: If you're the kind of golfer who's always wished the beer cart could follow you to every tee box, who dreams of having ESPN on a flat screen at every hole, and who wants to play the same fairway 18 times in a row, TopGolf is the place for you. Like a driving range and a nightclub merged into one, it's a fun place to hang with friends, throw back a few drinks, and smash golf balls into the night.   But it's not really golf.   During a recent visit for a friend's birthday party, we were impressed both by the massive scale of the South Charlotte facility, as well as the personal service that made the experience less intimidating. The cocktail and beer selection was superb, and our golf bay clean, comfortable, and well-equipped. But the quality of our dinner buffet left a lot to be desired, and the computer scoring system (which is supposed to track how close your ball comes to one of the targets on the range) was frustratingly difficult to operate and understand. Most of our party started to lose interest in hitting balls off the mat after about an hour, at which point we could've had the same experience at a few dozen better clubs or restaurants.  The problem with TopGolf is that it isn't a great enough experience for skilled golfers, and doesn't give beginners a way to really try their hand at the game. It's just a place to mess around and hit balls with your buddies. There's nothing particularly wrong with that, but for my money, I'd rather spend an afternoon playing an actual round.

-jGwYa71eZR3Zo7n8dFMHg.text: Got to experience them for the first time not long ago. I've been hearing all the hype and it was great to finally see if it's worth it. In a nutshell, it's not horrible but if you're a golfer and just want to get some practice in, it may not be the best place for you.  The food is actually pretty good. Both quality and variety. Plenty of bar food to choose from but also lots of shareables like flat bread, nachos and wings. You can find plenty of healthier options including some decent salads. There's even a peculiar dessert of round fried batter balls that you can inject with raspberry, chocolate or cream. Kinda addictive! Lots of beer and drink options too. Not sure how swinging metal clubs around while mildly intoxicated has worked out for them but I imagine injuries occur here from time to time.  The prices are honestly a bit high to golf here. My office decided against an outing because of how expensive it is. I honestly think it was a good idea. Unless our office can fit into one bay (I think 6 people max) it's hard to really have a truly social outing here. And the individual prices per person are $25/hour on the off hours and go up from there. Even bowling, for example, is a whole lot cheaper around here. Or if you just gotta hear that "thwack" you can probably just go to a regular old driving range or a batting cage.

ta8ZGfXCC1fJH5aC9x2WaQ.text: 3.5 stars for food, 5 stars for entertainment. If you can afford it, it's way more fun than bowling on a weekend night with friends. I would recommend minimum 2 hours. So the nachos & the queso are excellent. It's a bummer the nachos only come with 8 though. Our waitress was super nice & brought us more chips and salsa when we were almost out but still had queso left. The salsa is a sweet mild. The pepperoni flatbread was a let down-frozen pizzas are just as good if not better.

cRTSRwzLCdMjgGReokBF0g.text: When I tell y'all I had a BALL at Topgolf, that's an understatement!! We went on a Friday night for a friend's birthday gathering and our experience was EXCELLENT!! We had to wait in line but that's to be expected for such a new spot with an innovative concept. It's worth the wait! After reserving two bays for a group of  11 guests and there was a 45 minute wait. We went upstairs and ordered drinks while sitting in the patio area. There was a DJ playing pretty good music and the drinks were reasonably priced so it made the time go by faster than expected. We made plans to order a meal before playing but our bays became available and we decided to hold off. Our waiter, Jeffrey, was AWESOME!! He explained everything to us and helped us get set up. He took our orders and made EXCELLENT recommendations for food choices. I ordered the backyard wings with fries and they were SUPERB! I can't say that I haven't considered going back just so I could order those wings to go. I like my wings extra crispy and would recommended asking them to be cooked a little longer but they were so yummy! The golfing experience wasn't as frustrating as I'd imagined because I was actually hitting the ball and scoring some points! I would tell everyone to try TopGolf!!! It's worth the wait and you won't regret it!

Bartenders seem to hate there job and once we got sat our server was so rude. All of our tabs were messed up due to the fact the the server refuse to give is an itemized copy. xsce3ekm3mKJM6QTd7RzfQ.text: 2 appetizers 1 pitcher of beer 1 lemonade 1 mock cocktail= 67.00...I think,we were over charged....pay attention to your bill.....

LMWAwhsvVmGXpWkcMoSOBA.text: There is a recurring theme with the service at Topgolf, in that there seems to be a lot of waiting for it. We, like many others, were given a 2 and a half hour wait for a bay to play. No problem, we will just hit the restaurant.   It took the waitress 15 minutes to acknowledge us, another 15 to get the drinks (minus what we had ordered from the bar a that took 10 minutes on top of that!). 40 minutes to get a beer.   They need real change to the personnel and work flow if they will be successful beyond the first visit hype around the grand opening.   And the wings were gross and undercooked, but no one even asked us how they were.   Good luck, hope your experience is better than mine!

vBBiSxSoAJYXwGEDg0Sxhw.text: We came, we saw, we Topped some golfs from the mezzanine. My lovely bride and I stopped in for a quick visit: I used to play at all manner of golfs but she only ever did the windmill kind so we figured she could have a go at whacking the small ball in a low pressure environment while I tried to find my swing. The signing up part was irritating and slow and had to be re-done because the cashier managed to misspell my name while holding my credit card (I didn't make a huge scene but really, my name is right there on the card) We were escorted to the second floor and given the nickel tour of the hitting bay including club selection and how to choose games. I had topped some golfs in Austin when visiting my sister and had it mostly figured out but life is better when I don't have to try to remember anything but stand up and hit the ball (BTW: I'm pretty sure that the fields are reversed there-to-here and am also pretty sure it would matter if we were keeping score which we weren't but still...) Since we were just goofing around the scores and targets and aiming didn't mean much, my best girl got to come with and had some fun plus I got range time, sort of. Kinda spendy but it isn't like we're going to do this every night. We hit some golfs, we lit some lights. We smooched, we giggled! Yea us!

e5J69Jaq7cX3TVnVXsR74g.text: The food at top golf is absolutely horrendous. It tastes like cheapo store bought microwave food, except it's not cheap. I would highly recommend avoiding ordering food here.

CKIhBYHXdvtPHz4XAv0Eow.text: I have been anxiously waiting for TopGolf to open that I ended up going a few days before they officially opened. It's bowling meets golf. Since it was opening week, they were still working out kinks. Other than programming the right time of play everything was fine. We were on the very far right end which made it harder to target the bays that were to the left of me. The ones that were straight in front of me were really far. After our hour was up we ate food at our table and I felt like they were rushing us out. My only suggestion is that you pay per game. Golf isn't something you normally rush. And if people are eating and drinking in between than it's harder to enjoy the experience if there's a time limit. It's also a bit pricey if you go at night. The only good way to do TopGolf for cheaper is if you get more people to play. I believe the max is 6 per bay but you'll probably need 2 hours. Another complaint I have is they have a driver that you can use but you can't even use it because the tee doesn't adjust height at all. I wish they had the tees like they have at Leatherman that automatically tees the ball for you and you can adjust the height.  Came back again a month after opening and it seems they still don't have their kinks worked out. Some of the employees seem lost still. We were playing at our bay and a host asked if we were using it as we were swinging. Also, I told the guy when we first walked in that we had a $10 off coupon. Before we played noticed that they didn't apply it. Apparently you're supposed to wait in a different line if you have a coupon. Also we arrived with enough time to play before the rates went up but with the long waiting time we had to pay the higher hourly rate. There's nowhere to really wait unless you want to eat while you wait. The lobby is too full to wait in and the two pool tables were always in use. Luckily it wasn't busy in the dining area and the server graciously let us sit while we waited. It also would've been nice if the host that told us we had a long wait let us know that there's a place we could store our clubs. We noticed this room as we were looking for a place to wait and asked someone about it. Also, half of the parking lot was empty as it was reserved for valet parking. Cars were parked all along the driveway even though there were so many empty spots but you had to pay for those.

3-20KSvM1Cinnd4ycScG7Q.text: Average average average.  I really can't think of a better way to describe it.  Going 2/5 only because the marketing team did too good of a job overhyping this place.  Which made my last few experiences underwhelming  The concept is a great idea but waaaaay over commercialized.  Expensive food and drink for the quality and at $45 an hour for a bay after 5pm it just doesn't make much sense.    Fun idea, poorly executed.  You'll have more fun at a local driving range for half the price.   And no 2.5 hour wait!  Final note - parking is horrible here.  Not sure what the developers were thinking when they designed this place but hope they didn't get hired again

mFJj_7HH64c2ewqAOsVkkw.text: Such a fun time once we FINALLY got seated. They told us it would be a 1.5 hr wait and it was over 3 hours before we were given a booth. No one apologized, no one cared. We were never compensated for our lost time (which I generally don't look for but in this case they had wasted so much of our day and money running up a bar/food tab waiting that I figured they would do SOMETHING?) very frustrating experience, this location really needs to get their act together.  For reference- we arrived at 4:30pm on a Thursday.

29_hPOlKXPP0CsPbWidzIg.text: Beautiful facility, exactly what Charlotte needed!!   Love this location is the experience similair to newer facilities TX. Great concierge, food - quesadilla & wings were good and the price structure was on point. Plenty of parking including a valet option.   Only feedback I have for management is about the tall tables that are behind each couch. They need to bolted to the floor. We didn't realize the height of them and closeness to the couch. I sat down and hit my head pretty damn hard (headache worthy). Apparently the next table over did as well. Since the tables aren't taller than the average height of person sitting in front of it, causes easy issue. Until they fix it, just push it back into the isle, so its not a buzz kill.

CLc7MJDeallwfvPCVQrfww.text: Horrible bar service! They could make so much more money if they had decent bartenders!! They are awful. They have zero personality and the Asian girl was more worried  about what she looked like then helping someone. I asked 4 people for my tab. It took 30 minutes in an empty bar HORRIBLE SERVICE. Get it together top golf

WMb_uMVpiAR1qDVZdFz2sA.text: Third time here, it's always fun. Great service. Bit of a long wait, but that's because everyone wants to play! There's cornhole, pool, and a couple other games in case you have a long wait.

7uN1l4_Ta3OHs3zpIoDxcA.text: The overall customer service was pretty good. The food here is AWESOME! I have had the nachos, quesadillas and the pizzas. The golf caddy drinks are okay, I would prefer them to be stronger. I just normally order a beer and keep it moving. Overall experience was good.

1khER07z-hdY_iPTEj4RGQ.text: First time at the Charlotte location but I've frequent the one in Atlanta. I attempted night time upon several occasions and was stopped quickly by the two hour waiting time. So I vouched to go on my Monday off and I arrived around 4. The price was $35 per hour between the hours 12-5pm which was cheaper than the typical $45. I had a HARD NIGHT before (too many Makers and ginger) so I go a sparkling water which was pretty tasty. Also if you can always request the 3rd floor which overlooks all the targets. Also my golf club of choice was "The Wood". Stayed for an hour and a half and really enjoyed myself. Happy Swinging

u5mUg5fDbJB-EcGDScoeig.text: This place is as advertised! When i first pulled in off the Exit, i was blown away by the size of the facility.  Inside they have a fully stocked bar with all the regular spirits and a variety of local beers on tap.  I went with their "Tipsy Palmer" (obviously a stiff Arnold Palmer), which was perfect in the heat.  I was there for a soft open, so they rolled out a few apps for us.  The "Mushi" was my favorite. It had shredded chicken, mixed with sticky rice, avocado, cheese, sour cream, cilantro, beans, Sriracha in a jalapeno tortilla  wrap.  I also tried the cocktail shrimp, which was very solid!  For dessert, they brought out "Injectable Donut Holes"...yes, that's as good as it sounds!  You pick between 3 flavors: chocolate, raspberry jelly and my favorite, Bavarian Cream.  This is a must try!   Think of this place as one of the coolest bowling alleys you've been to....except for golf.  Perfect setup for 4-8 people (more if you double up cubes) to hit some balls, they have games you can play as a group, eat, drink, also plenty of Tv's for big sporting events.  My only concern for this place is that they will be to popular!

EdDxZ2awi0nW7GE470bZIQ.text: I went  for a group party not familiar with how things work I went to the check in desk and asked about the reservation. The guy at the desk looked for the reservation but could not find it so I asked if the could accommodate a small group without a reservation. Then the guy left walked through the bar area came back after a few minutes(I have no idea where he went or what he did) he came back after a few minutes and found the reservation--then abruptly became very rude told me to go to the bar and wait for my EA--that I was to early--I had no idea what an EA was and why he became so rude. You better know how things work before you go there or they will treat you like and idiot. Extremely rude front desk people--really ruined my whole experience!

_sU42qobK1Eg_vWJLs4Hfw.text: I went here on Sunday morning for my dad's birthday. They opened at 9, and my family (who has been here previously) told me to get here earlier because it will be super busy! So, when I arrived they had two lines; the first was if you already had a membership card and then second was if you needed a membership card. The card is only $5 and it last a lifetime. I paid for my card online the night before, so I only had to show them the email confirmation when I got to the register. Although the line for the membership was really long, maybe 30 minutes, I did not have to wait for a bay because my family was already waiting for me! The bag has a L-shape couch and a table to eat at as well as clubs for us to use (unless you are left-handed then they bring you clubs up). The floor was sticky... you can definitely hear it when you walked. When we sat down we began looking through the menu (because I was starving). I decided on the French toast! The picture looked amazing. The actually golfing is rather fun - even if you have never played before or in my case, suck at golf. I think my high score was around 48 points... anyways, my food has finally arrived! I felt like it took a while for it to come, and when it did we did not even have silverware. I took one bite, and was disgusted. The strawberries were great! The syrup was great! But the toast, was wayyyyy to burnt and hard! It was suppose to be fluffy, right? I had to send it back after only having one bite. I asked my family (we were in two bays) what they ordered before and if it was good - I didn't want to chance a bad meal again. I ended up ordering the buffalo chicken sliders (even though it was 10 AM). They arrived and looked delicious! It came with lettuce and tomato on the sliders, with a side of ranch for dipping. They weren't amazing, but I would probably order them again. Our server was eh, she didn't seem to check on us that often and when we wanted to order some drinks she never seemed to be around - we ended up starting a tab at the bar because we can never track her down. After about 2.5 hours I did not want to golf again, but I did want to stay to watch everyone play and enjoy the beautiful weather! A little after I stopped playing the ball dispenser stopped working! We grabbed a guy, he looked like a manager, and he walked over to our bay. We was very nice and was joking around with us! I cannot remember his name... but he added 30 minutes to our time because we had to wait. Then the screen went dead. Dead! We grabbed another gentleman, who looked like a manger as well. He told us the computer tech would be up in just a few minutes. It wasn't long and he was helping us! He basically had to reset the monitor and re-swiped the membership cards. Once he was done, he said he gave us a little bit more time. After playing about 20 minutes, we wanted to know how much time was left... when we checked he gave us 2 hours!! Overall, yes I would come here again. Do not expect the best waitress but their management staff is spectacular! And it is a bunch of fun!

SuKuCi9F1vj5-gYABg576A.text: I'm a fan of Topgolf.  My apartment complex offers us the use of the Platinum card, so we get the red carpet treatment.  They bring up the Callaway clubs, put me on the top deck and off we go!  Great spot to hang out and hit some balls.  I enjoy the people watching as well.  This location is always busy and the crowd is mid 20s - young 30s.    Beers and food are not as expensive as you would think.  Standard domestic drafts are around $4.50, I think?  Food comes out fast and is legit.  Stick to the basics, flatbread pizza, nachos, etc.  I'll be back soon!

cv9J8O-bd3mt8jmANknK0Q.text: Let's just say I'm a fan.  Topgolf seems to be busy 24/7 every time I drive by the parking lot is full, seriously.  I've been 3 times, 2 with family 1 with coworkers. All 3 times we have had fun and enjoyed great food and pretty good service.  I like the reserve a bay option online and even did a walk in today with no appointment and only waited 20 minutes. Food is surprisingly good.  I've had wings, flatbreads, Spicy Cauliflower and a few others and all I can think is that Topgolf has it figured out.  Good food, fun times which explains the fullness of the parking lot.

cz3NRoUJPYx2yt7o8ujcOQ.text: We decided to check on Top Golf last Saturday, as a spur of the moment activity. We were unable to make a reservation for a bay, but the website said they have several set aside for walk ins. We arrived about 11:30 (it's insanely easy to find), and proceeded to check in where we were told it would be a 2 hour wait. The hostess was kind, and explained the procedure. Basically she takes your name and phone number, and they send text updates. We spent a little bit of time hanging out there, and decided to go and grab lunch. As soon as we pulled into the parking lot (about 10 mins away), I received a text saying our bay was ready. I responded and it was ready for us to enter when we arrived back! That made out wait for a bay approximately 30 minutes (I had requested 2nd or 3rd floor). We played for an hour, and it was so much fun! They have clubs there to use, and a server to provide information, food and drinks. We didn't order food, only drinks. We can't wait to return!   FYI The one unexpected expense that we encountered was that everyone in the party is required to purchase a $5 membership. It is a one time purchase.

RdLEqWyy8LbEwi1IanGP7g.text: I was invited to top golf to celebrate my buddies birthday. I was a little skeptical because I have never played golf in my life. Nevertheless, this place is super cool and fun regardless if your inexperienced or level in golf. The obstacles makes the game fun and competitive with a group of friends. They have a bunch of tvs and fans to both keep you entertained and cool in the hot weather. Also they have a full food menu and drink menu. We ordered drinks and passed on the food since we already ate dinner, but the food looked very good. This is a great way to relax and drink with a group of friends.

b1pd1fqon2WXWTHOd8Ygnw.text: We had a super great time here! I love the setup, the concept, the atmosphere, the food... Everything was great. The staff were attentive and took great of us. I tried earlier in the day to reserve a bay but couldn't so we just went and waited for the first available one. It took 2.5 hours but truly we didn't even notice because we started with dinner and drinks and just kicking back in the downstairs lounge area. The pepperoni flatbread was pretty good but I think the crust could be better. The steak nachos were amazing. I mean that. They were sooo good. We also had the wing trio with mango habanero, teriyaki, and bbq. All of them were great. The white wine sangria was very light and we finished up with spiked lemonade. I thought the food was really good. Playing golf at night was fun and I enjoyed the bay. This is a place where you can take kids, go on a date, etc. Really cool spot.

Aex2JNeu1-Av2mGl56qT8g.text: Had a great Friday morning experience at Topgolf. Oscar was super friendly and helpful in getting us set up. He showed us how to set up our game and explained how it worked.  I was pleasantly surprised that Topgolf was much more than a driving range. There are a series of targets that you can earn points for hitting. There are short targets for those without much experience like myself as well as the long range targets for the experts. Topgolf also has a great food and drink menu. A server was constantly checking on us to see if we needed anything. I would highly recommend Topgolf for any type of group outing.

VAayarCogrAyb3y764j6XQ.text: I don't know about the food and I came during the day on a Friday, which is probably the best time to come. Most people are at work or school. There were still a good amount of people here but the vibe was pretty chill.   This review is strictly based on service.   My husband and I came in as walk ins. We walked to our... "terminal"? I don't know what these joints are called. A rep helped me (as a first timer) log in and like less than a min later Bethany (with the braces... in case there's another one with the same name) came thru with a smile asking us if we'd like any drinks or food. My husband and I just ordered drinks.   Around 5 min into our play time she checked on us. Everything was good.   Because I'm a newbie I "injured" myself so I had a little cut in my wrist. I asked her for a band aid and Bethany came out with three different ones. I only used one but she let me keep the other two. Their band aids are NICE. Like industrial grade bandages. These ain't Walmart or Target brand. These joints are like celebrity hospital grade. Okay enough about the band aids.   I like this place. It's a cute spot for a daytime chill. Imma have to check it out during rush time and see what they food talm bout.  Update: I decided to get the fish tacos. They were decent . $10 for tacos tho is a bit much... I had to take a star off for that. For $10 imma need them joints to be spectacular.

ok2rz5Rlbmn-gFzVBz5LFQ.text: Had a fun 1st experience but I don't know how many times I will ever return. I'm also not a big golfer but enjoyed the game end of it all. Definitely a fun experience playing the game and learning to hit the ball well by towards end of games.  I would definitely suggest employing more employees on the service side of it all. The service getting drinks and food were terribly slow and half the time when we got our beer/drinks they weren't even that cold. Also when receiving our food no utensils/napkins were given. We had to track someone down to get them and each time we wanted another drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

nbIjnDb5M-5Xh0PbkLxAFQ.text: One of the funnest places on earth, I mean how could it not be driving range+cocktails+food= The most fun you can have with your clothes on. Place is always super busy    But even when they have a full house there are plenty of things to do there, a huge bar, nice gift shop and restaurant/lounge. The upper floors book up fast because that is the best place to play from. Each ball has its own rfid so when you hit it the monitor in your hitting booth will tell you where the ball lands. There are multiple games available making it fun for a skill levels.

G8XZEAVVUmBV72-k1aFuZg.text: Always fun to have a group get together at Topgolf. The last time I was at one was in Las Vegas, which was extravagant. It was cool to see the same vibe carried through here in Charlotte.  My friends and I reserved two bays for a 1:30pm Sunday afternoon. Unfortunately we still had to wait about 30 minutes after we got there (on time) because they didn't have any bays next to each other. A little strange since we made the reservation all in one, but this place is ALWAYS packed. It's worth it to pay ahead to have a reservation.  We were all starving so we ordered a couple of buckets of beer and some food. A friend and I split the Steak Tacos and Chicken and Waffles which was honestly the perfect amount of food. The steak was REALLY good and the waffles and chicken were flavorful and came out hot. I was very impressed with the speed of service given how huge and crowded the place was.   Great selection of drinks as well. Sure to be a favorite in Charlotte for a long time!
