7oi8p8E8GEliMROboZanBw.text: Came here for the first time for Megan's birthday and had a great time. I had some wings (I think they were called the backyard wings), they tasted great but went right through me quicker than a frat boy shotgunning a white claw (I hung out with my son a little to much this summer as you can tell LOL). So be mindful ordering them if you are on a date and don't want to embarrass yourself. The golf was fun though, we were on the bottom level so all my hits looked like putts and I couldn't get them too far. Next time I will try to get a spot on the top level.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. New timer at top golf. Had a great time :)

Jdj-RU0Oc1cSVN9YgKgsnw.text: There's no arguing that Top Golf is an ingenious concept! When things go as expected here it's a gret time every time.  I've been to a handful of locations around the country and although still a good outing,  I typically have the least favorable experience here at the location in Charlotte. Even with that being saidz I yet to have a terrible experience here!  Usually I try to go during the week or first thing in the morning on a weekeend. Otherwise you can expect to wait for a few hours. Its not out of the question to get greated with a 2-4 hour wait on the weekends after lunch.   Our of the 5 or 6 times I've stuck around to play, I've had a good time. The service is all dependent upon how crazy things are but typically after 10 or 15 minutes in the bay someone comes to take our order.i have had one time where I had to seek out someone to take my order and another time where the waitress forgot to put our order in altogether.    Top Golf is great because even if you aren't a scratch golfer, you can squeeze out a solid score by just making contact with the ball.   Food wise I like their wings (pretty much every flavor) and the smokehouse burger. Their flatbreads/pizzas are also good for groups.    Summation,  if you go at a good time you'll have a blast. If you try to go when they are slammed its 50/50.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

uqLx0i4pFb3hIeMjOXT7tQ.text: I'm updating my last review because I was actually able to go and can give an actual review of the facilities and experience. I went with a group of friends on a Tuesday night, and it was half price bays (woo!). Otherwise, I think it's a little pricey for what you get. You only have an hour to play and then can extend your time in 30 minute increments. This can get pricey very fast if you go with a large group and if everyone wants to play because time runs out fast. We also had a reservation and it still took about 20 minutes to get our bay.  The actual facilities were really nice. The inside has a game area, a huge bar, lots of seating and TV's. The bays are equipped with clubs, touch screen game screens, TV's and heaters for the colder months. Our service was great and the food was actually pretty decent. Their bar has a large selection and the menu selection had variety as well.   There's not a ton of seating at each bay and they are close to other bays, so if there are two large groups, it can be tight. Parking on a Tuesday night was limited, so I can only imagine how it would be on a busy night. Overall, it was fun to experience but I wouldn't frequent TopGolf based on price.

8y8FW2xk-OsIG3cIs7eRGA.text: Top golf is a great place for friends and family alike. Bring the whole squad out and have fun for hours. There is plenty to do other than golf. They have food, drinks, pool, video games, and more. It's located about 20 minutes outside Charlotte so a little bit of a drive and there's not too much else going on right by it.   The Topgolf facility is top notch and well thought out. They are constantly busy but there is still plenty of seating room and TVs to watch. During the weekends expect there to be hefty wait if you want a good spot on the 2nd or 3rd deck.   You can reserve a spot and sometime it can cost a little bit extra to do so, so be prepared for that. As far as the driving range goes they have a lot more than your typical range. They have clubs already and you can also bring your own if you choose. Both left and right handed. You pay by the hour and balls are dispensed as you need from your machine. They have different games to play between your friends or you can just swing for practice. Plenty of options and that's what Topgolf has waiting for you!

sK7VZbEUxinPk1N77ShH_A.text: We came here to experience the gold but ended up ordering food as well. The Spicy Korean Fried Cauliflower were soooo good. The cheese fries were a little dry but it's because we omitted the craft beer queso. Also tried the Margherita flatbread pizza and nachos. All really good. Service was ok. Definitely will visit again. Oh and the Watermelon Mint mocktail was good as well

HlznSO_QLeCrt6UeGgZN2g.text: I am truly disappointed. I've always enjoyed my small group experiences at Topgolf, so to celebrate my father's 60th birthday I figured what better venue. We were planning several months in advance locking down guest lists and dinner reservations. Upon speaking with Topgolf, fees were estimated at $44-47 per person, plus additional charges for the REQUIRED catered package. We were looking at a quote around $1,000 for two hours for a group of 16 people. Since we have dinner reservations and they advertises $47 per hour on the weeks for a bay, the $1,000 dollar quote is astonishing.   If all you need is one bay Topgolf is a great place to have some fun! More than one bay, I highly recommend you look elsewhere so you don't break the bank as it is straight highway robbery.

c4OYulrjr2oerXcPVoXyjw.text: Rip off.  $50 to make reservations, $15 each for membership fee, $70 to hit balls for 2 hours. $165 for 3 people to hit balls for 2 hours. Rip Off Lunch was reasonably priced, mediocre food.

wUgNDCtVvgD4Qqlgi4Ga1A.text: This is such a cool concept. I should be coming here a lot more than I do.  Topgolf is fun for both the golf crowd and the "I don't play golf" folks (I fall in that category). There's several different game options to choose from here. This location has more than 100 bays. They are all climate controlled and have TVs. They also have a full service restaurant and bars. Your bay has a server, so you never have to leave to get anything. You can order from them (and for the love of god, please tip your server).  This place does get really packed and you can expect a wait, especially on the weekends. There is an option to reserve a bay online that allows you to skip the line. Note: there may be an extra fee for that. You can also plan and book events.   Currently, there's a promotion for half-price game play on Tuesdays and also unlimited game play on Mondays-Fridays from 9am-noon for $15 per person. I'm not sure how long either of these will last, so just always make sure to check the website ahead of time to see what kind of deals, promos, coupons are happening. Just click on the promotions tab (and make sure you're looking at the Charlotte location).

fM746AuV2t12wQTbRWGTPw.text: Great concept, there are none of these places in So Cal. So, to best describe it is like a bowling activity but with golf. You do the driving range activity over and over. The food was good, it was a company organized event so I am not sure how the rest of the food was. They do offer a variety of appetizers and bar food, burgers and so on. Everything tasted good, we had a party coordinator that took care of us. It is fun for family and friends to experience golf if they have never done it and it is a pretty popular activity in Charlotte NC.  The technology measures the distance that the golf ball travels, which is pretty neat.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great idea none in So Cal

qogluKQgHq2OeOwcZlHRlg.text: Average experience, below par compared to other top golfs in the southeast. Passive management at best, unless it comes to customer dissatisfaction.

KoAFc8gUAxZkqmE2hLzO9A.text: This place is super fun! My only hang up with this place is that playing is first come first serve. The wait can be really long. I'm not sure why they don't just take reservations especially on busy days.

VsW8gFVeeahQnRl7L-UZKA.text: So much fun, great atmosphere! I've never been on a weekend or night so I don't know how busy it may be. From the reservation times and fees I can imagine it's a lot going on. I love the donuts and being able to fill them was very nostalgic.

U7jvOG-qXpDMufsrnk2qCQ.text: Nasty rude servers!! Server mixed up the bills and got frazzled when I asked her to explain certain charges. She said and I quote "That's why large groups shouldn't do separate orders"...She also said "If you didn't come to pay then don't play."  Really!!! We had a large group but when you work with the public don't snap on customers when you are asked to explain and to separate the bills. Also, some of the food never arrived for our other group of family and friend until they were ready to leave (2 hrs later)! Reported incident to a manager, he apologized fir the situation and offered me a reservation pass for my next . He asked me to wait there because he'd be right back with the pass.   Unfortunately, he didn't come back at all. Damn that's the second strike against them. I decided to talk with another manager who in return decked to offer both parties reservation  passes. He returned promptly with the passes. I'm not certain if I'l ever go back there to use the pass. First time was awful and I don't want to patronize a business with poor customer service and rude servers!!

IfQiZOvtPwPNSQyMKByljA.text: Since it is new in Charlotte the wait time is still crazy long! On a Saturday that I went with a group of 5, we had to wait almost 2 hrs for a bay. So while we waited we wanted to get some food and drinks. The service was very chaotic in the bar area and it was hard to get our server's attention most of the time. Seating wise there were not a lot of sections in the bar area for more than 4. I think if they anticipated Topgolf to be so popular they might have wanted to make 2 bar areas. I still enjoy my time every time I go to Topgolf. The front desk staff are always very helpful to keep me updated on our wait time.

6jFgYmyhomWh4-OF3Ef3Mg.text: Plenty of people have already rated the overall experience here so I'm going to focus on the food and drinks- and the food is about what you'd expect- typical bar food. My friends and I ordered cheese fries and pretzel dippers while waiting for a bay. Both were good.  The three stars really is because of the drinks. I ordered a pineapple punch and my friend ordered a citrus cabana. The menu says they are sized for 2+ people each, yet there was little to no alcohol in the drink. My friend confirmed that there was almost no alcohol in hers either. You do get the souvenir light up cup that it comes in, but at $16 a pop I was disappointed. I would come back to Topgolf but skip the drinks.

cY2zF9yqCO6c1Il6o_tuCA.text: Sat at the bar for 30 minutes waiting to be served while about 10 employees stood around watching the World Cup. There's no excuses for this kind of service here.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

6YtWSQirM6pCLndz9jCLbQ.text: I got slow walked on receiving a lane/box. If you get slow walked like they do newbies walk to desk and the door right behind is door where they have the teenagers that dictate when you get a spot.  I just walked in and asked what the hold up was and boom I got a spot.  Management either is completely complicit with this activity or ignorant. I did have fun but you need stay on top of the $7.50 an hr folks otherwise you will death sit.

fnE628Imfic0psB7kYnEJw.text: This place is HORRIBLE. It is a Friday night. I am a TA for biology at UNCC & was teaching my students till 5 pm and had a physics review till 7 pm for my midterm Monday. Went to Topgolf after with my friends to relax. And because we were exited and happy we got cut off AFTER ONE BEER. Manager said "you are acting out of the ordinary so we don't know what you did before this." I was at school from 8 am till I came. We spent $50 for the reservation and another absurd amount on our food and then were cut off bc they did not want to serve us and  had gotten all the money they wanted out of us. Terrible service. Terrible management. Do not go. I hope our waitress and manager get fired because of how rude they were. I love all people and always have a great time so this was disgusting and shocking to me. Don't go, not worth the bullshit.

JT3XWAlsIj9mYoQZzugIHA.text: What a fun time! Laid back date night. Lil competition. Made reservations online several days in advance. Food was only decent. Shrimp cocktail was on the Southwest side. Burger was good. Lettuce wraps spicy. Scott the server was awesome.

HKHKguWCL6STG6Buj_WirQ.text: My family went for the 1st time yesterday. It's kind of confusing for a 1st time customer and Bambe at the guest services area was extremely rude.  She has the wrong attitude to be in customer service. If she hates her job she needs to find somewhere else to work. Other than her, the game was fun and we enjoyed it.

Jf03qOO1updLtEnb7x348w.text: We came on a Wednesday night around 8pm thinking it was going to be slower, but the place was crazy packed. So we were told the wait would be 2 hours wjich it turned out to be 1 1/2 hrs. During that time we ate somewhere else, so unfortunately we never tried any food.   When we arrived back, we were escorted to our section where we then ordered drinks snd started hitting some balls. The atmosphere was so live and everyone enjoyed themselves.

y9XJCni1tK4xsN-QdGvumQ.text: TopGolf is like a mix between golf, skee ball, and bowling all combined! Anyone can do it and it makes for an awesome date night, family outing, or something local to do with friends! The music is great, vibe is awesome, and food/drinks are delicious!

ECBF8g0k6xLYNoJ8M7BDLg.text: I am in town for the weekend from Raleigh for Scarowinds. I wanted to have a beer and food afterwards and we do not have a TopGolf in Raleigh nor have ever been to one. I arrived at 1:20 am on 10/29 and they close at 2am. I didn't know how playing worked and thought maybe I could buy a small bucket of balls and enjoy myself for at least 30 minutes.   When I arrived the greeters were very nice at the concierge/ reception counter and were very helping and directed me to the membership counter. A quick glance at the screen and I realized that this is not how TopGolf works and I don't have enough time to sign up and play. I then headed straight to the bar and took a seat. We were greeted fairly promptly. I asked for a food menu and the bartender told me that the kitchen was closed. I then asked what time does the kitchen close and he said 1:30. I then looked at my cell phone(world wide time clock) and it said it was 1:25am on the dot. He then called for backup to get someone else to tell us we couldn't eat basically. I was annoyed as I looked across the bar and saw people devouring their food that was delivered as I sat. Another bar tender then took over in assisting us and gave us menus and basically hovered over us and really putting on the pressure to order ASAP. We order the nachos and they were delicious but our bartender never asked us how was our meal, they never gave me side plates or napkins. Another individual who was taking out trash saw us eating and in concern asked if we needed napkins or anything else.  Basically, if you are going to advertise that you close at 2am then your employees should treat your customers like paying guest until 2am. Not like we are imposing on the servers or bartenders because all they are focused on is cleaning and closing everything down. Customer service completely was not their focus, which wasn't a good first impression at all.

9s9xaLplGL8bPOBJjjF5kg.text: The golf portion of this place is fun and the only aspect that brings people back.   The rest of your experience at Top Golf will have you looking for the exit and other options.   Wait times are long, service is slow, customer service is entirely absent.   Been here a few times and it's always the same. Last night we had a group of 8, ordering drinks/apps/desserts, all while in our 1st hour of play when all of a sudden our waitress (who wasn't even sure how to ring in my beer or if they even had it when I could see the tap handle from where we were) comes up and informs us that our time is up and we need to clear out or pay for another hour. At this point we still don't even have our nachos which we ordered at the start of the hour. We tell her we are still waiting on food and she says ok and goes to talk to who I assume is a floor manager of sorts. When she walks away we see that we still have more than 12 minutes left on our first hour. We decide not to do another hour (they were out of the dessert we wanted, the food was taking forever (on a cold Monday night in March) and the service was lacking to put it nicely) and the server and manager immediately start to try and clear our table. We tell them that we still don't have all our food, which we have already paid for at this point (and the bills were wrong, so wrong we didn't even say anything because it would have taken another 20 minutes for them to try and wrap their heads around that brain teaser) and they kind of leave us alone for a bit. This whole time is still within our hour of gameplay as the clock is still ticking down on the computer screen...  Our second choice of dessert finally comes out (s'mores cookies, basically some chips ahoy soft bake cookies sandwiching a marshmallow and drizzled with Hershey's chocolate sauce, not worth the money or the 30 minute wait time, not even sure how that's possible) and they immediately start to buss the table again. They make me and my girlfriend feel completely unwelcome as they whirl around us trying to clean up her beer which wasn't empty and the dessert plates on the table which we just received.   Everyone in our group is in the service industry (cooks and servers) so we know the deal. The level of service and quality of most of the food at Topgolf is on par with fast food restaurants, which is kind of an insult to Chik-fil-a.  Go for the golf if you go at all.

jWW9zCCeYvnhCKW2zdlsvw.text: Customer service is THE single most important thing for any business and tonight our service was shit. We were at Bay 109 (8:30-9:30) There was a mistake with our check and we were charged for extra time. Our server was trying to rush us out of that space (I get it, they want their money) but she had to fix our check and I guess it took too long for her and she brought some guy over (manager?) who was rude. He asked "You got everything figured out?!" and I asked him what figured out? He said, "I don't know but we need you guys out cause we have another group coming" (as the other people sat) We asked for a box for our food that we ordered and they couldn't waste time so that all got thrown away. That guy was an assclown.

q3mqBAqA6bAWMl2G12JOpA.text: I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago place was pack. Place is pretty big and busy. Had an awesome time even though I'm not a golfer. The top level views were amazing. Amazing place! Highly recommend checking it out. Super Fun!

I8B3e_eGoKPsFpUq5WtB6Q.text: Ridiculous waits. Slow service for a simple beer. I get it. It's the "spot". But the waits and service are terrible. Miss managed and understaffed.

Ys0bijsIXdbZF2G_Ir01RQ.text: Great time. Prices were affordable. Parking situation was a bit ridiculous. You can't even get cars in and out of the driveway at the same time. We waited longer to get out than we did for our golf bay.

0ZikkZNTXkvYe2Bf3ftJwA.text: Was a great time for meeting up with some friends after work.  It was very busy and expensive

BRFY2Bqvhi6kr9XyrXNYOA.text: Check in was so frustrating. The line moved very quickly but once it was our turn to check in it took THIRTY MINUTES even tho we are already members, due to the staff not knowing how to use the computer system. 3 different people tried to help her but nobody was able to efficiently problem solve. The  40 people behind us all passed us and then we were told to be patient because they are short staffed. At 11am on a Sunday. Really cruddy customer service.

C89Fccc0RpICyUk-pULo2w.text: Cool spot with good beer... however some of the staff is among the most unprofessional I've ever seen. My group was there till close and we were about to leave when a security guard told us to leave in which we respond, "no problem." One minute passes and the same security guard comes back and tells us we need to leave immediately while we are on our way out. Meanwhile there are plenty of other guests still hanging out longer than we were. As we are walking out the door I happened to mention the rudeness in the security guards tone... not that it should matter, but he heard what I said. Next thing I know this security guard and a manager followed us out of the building while coming at me with the utmost inappropriate remarks and tried taking a picture of my license plate which I thought was shady. I work in the service industry and if I treated my guests like these two employees did to us let's just say I wouldn't have a job. Will not be returning until management can better assess their interests in their employees.

e69EpcQ76Slz-9MN5-JtOw.text: Tried to go last night but left after sitting for half an hour without seeing a server. The people next to us were at the bar asking for someone when we left. So that's 2 full tables serverless for 30 minutes... on a Tuesday. Bad way to run a business from a place that wants $15 for a margarita.

A6qwtif0Pfst7v74YvOvTw.text: At first I could have gave this place 5 stars just from the initial WOW factor, it is certainly cool, fun and the facility is well designed and nice and all that but my review dropped rapidly with slow initial service. I went with a group of people from work on a bit of a "Team Building" exercise and so we had a booth rented out for the night and so certainly we wanted service and to have a good time and that means we were there to spend some money which of course is the reason they built this place. Now please know I am super forgiving to slow service at a small place that's packed, understaffed and when people are visible trying and efficient but that is not the case here, this place has tons of staff, they are just slow AF. I mean like actually slooooow, like they move really slow, I saw maybe 2 staff out of about 50 that had the body language, speed and attitude of professional high volume F&B people. At the main bar they had 3 bartenders and one was great, the other 2 would barley qualify to be cashiers at Taco Bell. Another example is when we ordered our 2nd round of apps the person brought them out, we had to move the empty baskets on to our seats, she unloaded her tray and started to walk away and I said (nicely) "oh hey let me hand these too you" the response from her was just a shrug and the slowest movement possible, in and of itself not a huge deal but just a total miss for a place that was obviously highly planed to be a high volume place offering a fun vibe. Honestly I could give the place 4 stars because overall we had a good experience but they did so well in conceiving and build this place to then staff it with C-Team talent I just could not give 4 stars much less 5. If anyone from this company reads this review I'm telling you you obviously know you have a gold mine and even with everything I said here there was a line out the door for the place but instead of staying longer and spending even more money (and for our group money was no object) we decided just to go elsewhere because the service was so lame, oh yeah and the scotch options were weak, basically a cool place but could really use some high-end options and then guess what, you would make even more money!!!

GDxQvZ3oWvGYaYh-8QTJwg.text: When we first sat down our server Bryan was very rude. We asked him for the drink specials and he didn't answer our question. He then told us if they had any it would be in the book. After waiting for 15 mins to get our waters, he finally came back to take our drink order. When we asked him about the menu he said "he didn't eat the food because he avoids fast food." He couldn't give us any recommendations. We paid for 2 hours of golf time and we never had our waters refilled or fished cleared. We had to wave him down to place more drink orders. After complaining to the manager who adeptly handled the situation. Bryan loudly complained about our area to a coworker after we spoke to the manager. So therefore we left no tip for Bryan. When we were leaving he chased us out into the waiting area demanding to talk about the lack of tip. The fact that he had the nerve to aggressively come at me is completely unacceptable. All of our previous experiences at Topgolf have been wonderful. This server does not have a place there. It's unfortunate that you have a team member that reflects so poorly on your business.

2bClXdNZ9Bwa94jLu6q3_g.text: PLEASE GET IT TOGETHER.  Bad experience from beginning to end. Tried to have dinner sat at a dirty table then they totally skipped a dinner. No waitress at the bag, then had to wait 30 minutes because the machine ran out of balls.

OS_txxzABEmNswQHE0cXDQ.text: Game was fun - service needs major improvements. I get they are new but it's as if no one there knows what's going on. While waiting for our bay, we went to the third level bar and ordered drinks. First off there were only 2 bartenders for a very crowded bar area. Took 20 minutes to get poorly made drinks and we watched as food sat on the bar for 15 minutes as no one knew which table it went to. Once at our bay, it was apparent the communication in this place between employees was horrible. We were told they were out of straws and limes, we personally walked to another floor and found both these items on the other floor from the bar.... come on. Then our food came our wrong and at different increments. I was completely done with my food by the time my side of fries even came to the table which I had to remind our server about 3 times. Not once did a manager stop over to check in, nor did the server try to get anything done to make up for the errors and slow delivery times. I work in the hospitality industry and this is just unacceptable. I know things like this happen but it's all about how you recover by going above and beyond to make the situation better, and a simple I'm sorry goes a long way too. Tip to management, train your staff better and be more present in the evening. We will be back hoping the kinks get worked out.

7yLaSIhHCdZdqBdW6kcqpA.text: Deshawn B. gave us awesome service  and the food was excellent! This is an excellent way to spend a few hours with family or friends!

4dQvxOUn5CCN7xcQUHlLRQ.text: The golf part was seriously lots of fun- our family all had a great time playing, but we waited close to an hour (literally) for our burgers that had hard buns like they had been sitting under a warmer for a long time; they really were pretty bad and everyone in our group's stomachs aren't feeling that great right now as I write this; everyone is very disappointed with that part. I had to ask our waitress 3 times to check on our food, and the 3rd time went to go find her and her manager was with her; he said he would check on our order (but didn't even apologize). It would've been nice if she took the situation in mind and (like most places that make that kind of mistake) offered to remove at least one of the burgers off our check, but she didn't. However, I will say the appetizers were good. Guacamole was outstanding - I mean really good. Overall, we had a good time, but it was SUPER expensive. Plan to bring your Platinum card. (The bill for 2 appetizers, 4 burgers, 1 turkey wrap, a couple sodas, and 7 adult drinks came out to $180- and that wasn't including the $45/hr golf bay rental, and we were there for 2-1/2hrs. So $300  overall (for 5 people)-- yikes! Expensive night!

HnL9lzmO2iobohwsH0L6FQ.text: My wife brought me here for my birthday we where told it would be a 4 hour wait. Then as we tried to check in the people managing the line told other people to jump in front of me checking in. When we came back from waiting 3 hours we tried to order drinks and nobody at the bar would aknowledge us. I don't know if there's take this way all the time I guess it's because it's new but the staff did say it's been a minimum of a 2 hour wait since opening. I found it very poor service and management overall.

Uc44eBVemPYYoM67FZKvEg.text: Our server, DeShaswn, was great. He's attentive, energetic, & fun. Our food & drinks were good too. We're definitely coming back to Top Golf.

iMpq6qPUTnsntuYbg0P8pA.text: I've never been to a Top Golf before, so I don't have much to compare it to but... This place was completely understaffed. Especially it being a holiday. My sister and I arrived with our parents today and waited in line to get Top Golf cards, which you need to have. Understandable. Then we went to the dining area to get food drinks since it was an hour wait for the bay. No one came over to us for at least ten minutes, so my sister and I ordered drinks at the bar. While we waited for our drinks to be made we asked if we had a server because my family was very hungry and thirsty. We were told that we should have one but that they were swamped so the bartender said she would  come over to take our food order. We sat down and a few minutes later the waitress came over and took food orders. We forgot to ask for water for our parents, but usually that is just brought to the table. Since it wasn't, we went to the bar again and waited for waters. We continued to wait for our food and were finally offered comped chips and salsa for waiting, since the server said they came out right away. Our bay was finally ready, so we headed up and told the server to transfer our food bill to our bay. We get to out bay and go over all the precautions and sign the waivers with our cards. Our food finally arrives with no utensils and no dressing on the salad...and there are no balls. Oh, and the chips and salsa never came either. Fine. They move us to the next bay and we had to ask the server upstairs for silverware.  We did not care about the salad dressing by then. Finally we think we are about ready to start, and guess what.....the balls aren't coming out. The technician comes over to fix the ball situation and we are able to start hitting balls and we had a great time.   We are ready to leave and ask for the check and it comes out with chips and guacamole on the bill but we never even ordered the chips and guacamole. Was that supposed to be our comped chips and salsa that they were now charging us for? Overall, the golf experience was good, but the food or service was not.

uJgXMb6ZyvjxiafehiXGUg.text: Worst food.. or at least the pulled pork expensive dog food. The makers mark manhattan was extremely sour smelled like puke. After the expensive prices and the 2.5 hour wait it's just not worth it. I even golf and love to play but all of this is not worth it at all!

zhWHuV1JBHNUi_te9-spoA.text: This place is fantastic! The food is awesome and so is the staff. They're always so energetic and excited for their guests. They are also a very charitable organization and actively donate to many charities and help those in need.

Exi1mKK7wgUT69PE4AZHcw.text: Top golf is very fun, food was okay, service was slow but they were really busy so that was expected(opening weekend) One star is for the valet company they use! After a night of fun, valet retrieved my car. Right when we saw my car I, the owner of the car, my boyfriend and my dad all saw a dent in my driver side door that was not there. It was like it was opened on a pole or something. We notified valet and conveniently my car was parked right next to the owners "brand new car with nothing wrong on it". Owner said he would look at the video (on the 11th) and reach back out but the end of the day. After no update I finally reached out on the 14th for one. Said he would be sending a email, which he did and of course in it it was stated that after review of the video they didn't see anything. He also said he would call(never did). On the 16th I said that I would need to see the video because how do I know they are telling the truth without me seeing it? He asked what would be a good day and I told him.  He the asked if I was available for a call that day, I said yes. Guess what? No call. A few days later was told I can't see the video blah blah blah FIGURES. Then the owner said "I don't mind helping a bit in good faith".  Good faith lol. I don't even care at the point after countless promised phone calls, really no updates, and them just saying they didn't do anything but I can't see the video so how do I know?? I don't need someone "helping me a bit in good faith". I've just learned my lesson about valet.

-0F2C917ZqbCsGgCnGm2rg.text: Great facility, horrible service. We had a bd party for kids, 20 guests (kids and adults) and one server. It took our server 1 hour to bring "unlimited" drinks, one hour to find a cork screw to open wine, the monitor never synced up the names....

rVSN8PET3YnuN30COhPZog.text: Best Friday afternoon work outing EVER. I was lucky enough to visit Topgolf on a Friday afternoon this week with some coworkers, and we had such a great time!   The taco buffet we had for lunch was really tasty - I highly recommend this menu choice for others looking to have a dining experience with a larger group (we had around 25 people altogether). We had plenty of food (chicken and beef, soft taco shells, rice, beans, chips and salsa, non-alcoholic bevvies), and everything was really flavorful, which to me is impressive given that most people probably don't come to Topgolf solely to chow down.   I can see why this place gets so crowded -- like previous reviewers have mentioned, it feels like going to a bowling alley, but... you're golfing (or attempting to, in my case!). It's a great atmosphere to come with a group for a special occasion.   Every staff member we met was very friendly and helpful - very much appreciate this as we were all first-timers.   Looking forward to my next visit!

amzU9xQ2BYj0gk5qOPrJfw.text: I have gone here about 3 times so far and 2 of my experiences have been amazing. I think that the food and drinks are good and affordable. Music is good. One thing I thought was weird was that I couldn't find the prices online per hour before arriving. The price basically gets higher the later in the day you go from $25-$45. Great for big groups (you can split the hourly price), but if I were to go with a big group again I would definitely suggest more than an hour. Went with a group of 6 and only hit about 3 times in that hour because they recommend you hit 5 balls at a time. Going with one other person allows you to hit a lot! The time that was not so great was on a weekday at about 4pm. They said the wait would be about 20mins and turned into about an hour, because they had bigger groups to accommodate that they were waiting to arrive first. Didn't feel important or that they updated us on the extended wait time enough. Luckily we could sit at the bar or we would have left.

PODZWOt7hBi4FrGWsqXZyQ.text: Topgolf is the place to have fun while hanging out with friends.  Upon arrival on a Saturday night, cars were parked on the side street.  I was fortunate to find a space there when a car pulled out.  After walking around to the front of the building, I saw there was a very long line of patrons waiting to get in.  A staff member who came around to answer questions of the patrons in line mentioned the line was to get a membership card, which is needed to participate.  If you already had a card, you could go ahead and get your name on the waiting list for a pod.  There were three registers open but it was taking a really long time to get individuals registered.  After getting to the front of the line (via friends in our party), our pre-reserved pod was ready.  It happened to be the one right in front of the lobby area.  No big deal as the music was so loud, nothing in the lobby got our attention.  The place was wild.    There was one staff member, let's call her a guide, who came around to show us how to operate the computer, etc.  She said our waitress would be along shortly.  After a long while, I grabbed her to get the waitress and send her to our table.  Our table should have had six chairs but the pod people next to us took three of them for their party.  I had to convince the guide to get our chairs.  She couldn't do it and had to grab a manager.  He came by and got us three chairs from somewhere.    Did I mention the music was really loud?  You had to yell at each other to conversate.  We finally got drinks and food.  The food is pretty good and the prices are reasonable.  I thought the price for the play time ($45/hour for the pod) was high but I don't know much about paying to play golf.  It was a lot of fun but I could have done without the really loud music.  Maybe it's not as loud on the higher levels.   They also have a bar/restaurant area, and a DJ was upstairs playing in front of the dance floor.  If you want to hang out on a weekend night, this is a great place.  If you are serious about hitting golf balls, you definitely want to visit on a weeknight.  It's a great place for kids any day but the weekends are a bit much for the young ones.

RKKx89hqvjrKAXscg9EaKw.text: What a fun experience but the food sucked! We went on a busy Saturday night but fortunately we reserved a bay. The atmosphere was great and very diverse. I loved that the golf field was lit up with different colors. The screen that showed you your performance was a great interactive way to stay engaged. Again, the food was terrible and overpriced. We did have a pineapple alcoholic drink which was ok. If I go back it will be just to play golf

o_Yey0K2gxePuJzh_wB5EQ.text: What a great experience! Took my family for the first time Saturday night and man was it PACKED! We had about a 2 hour wait which was fine because my kids were playing a huge connect four game downstairs while me and my wife had drinks.  We ate at our bay on the 2nd floor and the food was great (yet kinda pricey, but worth it) our waitress Emma was great,fast and helped my kids swing! Will definitely be returning!

vQ2-ZQWH0hXletWIJbu-Fg.text: We went out here after work on a Friday night, I had a good time for sure.  We had a booth on the main floor, it was really convenient. The waitress took really good care of us, she was a delight. Manager checked on us a few times which was nice. We ate the Sharable pretzel app... yum. With my belly full of adult beverages that pretzel was perfection. The bathrooms were really clean, I always check for that! I feel like the bathroom says a lot about the company. The only thing was I felt like it was expensive. I'm not a golfer by far so maybe I'm a bit crazy. But if you spend 2 or 3 hours in a booth plus drinking it's a pretty penny. I absolutely want to go back for more fun.   Loud music check Fun music Alcohol flowing Would return

64Ong5BpZJRED-HJhZ3KXg.text: If I was just reviewing the golf experience and entertainment aspect of the experience, I would be more generous with the stars but when it comes down to the food and especially the beverage it is highway robbery. I went out for an adult evening, hoping to drink a few adult alcohol  beverages and relax and have some fun and I should have saved my money and drank water because as a 5 foot 2, 100 pound girl, usually 2 drinks is all I need to get to my happy place, and 4 drinks later, I'm just poorer and grumpier that I didn't get the slightest buzz off of the 3 coconut mojitos or 1 Moscow mule I tossed in there as a final attempt to catch a buzz. I even mentioned something to the waitress in hopes my next drink would have a tad bit more alcohol but nothing improved. Go for the golf and not for the bar. The food is mediocre and the bar is terrible.

cw95etOGUjH8ZPraD9drgQ.text: Had my 3rd visit in last 3 months as a part of a group event this time.  The previous  2 times were for work related functions but not a formal event.  Each time it is the same thing... the kiosks at each bay are excruciatingly slow  and often make errors.  Then, you stand there waiting for the 0 to change to the correct score and the "meter" keeps running.  Top Golf is like being in a cab in a busy city with lots of lights that are red.  The seating is awkward - unless you get one of the couch bays.  The rectangular tables might be better served if they were turned 90 degrees.  As to the food, it's average pub food.  The wings which we ordered each of the first 2 visits, came out mushy and just seemed undercooked.  The brisket - which was served at the event - was the fattiest brisket I have ever had.    And to boot, the place is really expensive when you add everything up.  On a positive, good beer selection, and the wait staff is mostly friendly.  The folks at the front desk area could use a lesson in warmth.

HYSyfIb7YCLbpGCmGX1Xaw.text: Whether you come to play golf, just hang at the bar for a drink and watch the game, or just to eat you can do that here. Don't think you have to come just to play golf. Playing the actual game is really fun (and not just because I'm actually pretty good) but it's just the whole experience especially with the right group of people. There is usually a pretty long wait time so now that you can make reservations online that would be your best bet. But they do charge for the most popular days/ night like Friday & Saturday's, but it's pretty busy during the week as well. The service has been pretty good with not too many complaints. And the food is delicious! I've tried just about everything and my favs are the signature nachos and the grilled backyard wings, the chicken sandwich is also on point! And yes I've been here just to eat before lol. The drinks are good as well but the golfbags could be a little stronger even though you need two people to even order it.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Signature Nachos

3GECcOnP1PDhn8d_v_S3Dw.text: So before I write this review, I should state that I suck at golf. Scratch that, I am basically N/A at golf because, besides the lovely game of putt putt, I have never even swung a golf club. Fast forward to end of review..... I had so much fun at Topgolf!  My husband and I came over his lunch break one Monday that I had off of work. The setup was super impressive and the inside is very nice looking. His company is a Platinum card holder so we got the royal treatment (ie. didnt have to wait in any lines and got fancy golf clubs). At first, I was barely getting the ball off the tee. However, at the end, I was hitting the targets like crazy! We played for a bout an hour and a half. Since the Platinum card comes with Topgolf games for free, it was nice not to have to worry about timing of how long we were playing.   The waitresses stopped by regularly and we ordered pulled pork sliders and chips/salsa/guac. The sliders were delicious and the guac was nicely made.   Overall, I am a huge Topgolf fan after this experience. It was a fantastic way to spend my Monday afternoon and we will definitely be back!

DxCfZkWs09dFGS126ytIAA.text: I've been here multiple times for work events. It's a great place to socialize with coworkers and grab a drink. The food isn't the best but it's typical bar food.   I recommend going in a large group so it's cheaper for playing golf.

cKQVhpxdvxx3AU7hnU9FlA.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. Food is average and the service is slower than a turtle. You are not making the game of golf more fun!

DdtIvT8_1SqAZITGxRAyIw.text: We had a really nice time celebrating my birthday here, but it was a wait because it was on a Saturday evening! We enjoyed the venue, and the whole concept of golfing and having a good time drinking, eating, and hanging out with friends.

6YwmPm6hL7cW-gLOFOvqrw.text: I LOVE Top Golf! I come here at least once a week and it never disappoints. I would however work on timeliness of food service as well as promptness. Great establishment,  only a few kinks to work out

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

y4P7gJ4zRpZUSH0zH_qmHg.text: My husband and I have been here multiple times. In past visits we have had a pleasant time. I find it a great place for groups. The food and drinks are excellent. However, I have to admit the drinks are very pricey. The food is delicious. No they are not large portions, but its really nice to graze while you play! Definitely make sure to try the steak nachos. They are amazing! Our last experience was less than spectacular. We were celebrating our parents anniversary. At first when we arrived we requested a lounge, were told this request could be accommodated and then when we walked up the stairs to the third floor, found that we had been placed at a high top. We had a small child with us, so we had to ask that we were moved to a lounge. The hostess insisted that I had to go back downstairs with her to be moved. However, when we went back downstairs, it turned out I was not needed. Then when we arrived at the lounge, we asked for right handed children's clubs and a set of left handed adult clubs. The host arrived with left handed children's clubs and the adult clubs were left handed however there were only 3 clubs in the bag! The children's clubs were corrected but only after quite some time but we never did get a full set of left handed clubs. Next, our server came to set us up to play. She was extremely rude to us. When we asked what the price of a certain drink was she said "well the menu is in front of you, isnt it." We explained that it did not have the price and she said, "well I dont know how much it is, probably no more than $15." Two players had lieftime memberships but forgot their cards and we asked if we could just pay the $1 replacement fee as we had before instead of the $5 for a whole new membership. She said they have never done that, which was strange since we had done that before. She seemed very frustrated and upset in general. We tried to order appetizers from her and she said "wait, Hold on." and just left without taking the order! 5 minutes later, another server came up and explained there was a shift change and she would be taking care of us. She was very nice and we had a pleasant time after that.

9y2F7m48j7rYavfjZyGDgg.text: My boyfriend and I love to come to Topgolf anytime we visit Charlotte. He is an avid golfer.. I have been golfing less than 10 times in my life. We both always have a blast.   Topgolf is basically a driving range with certain targets to aim for. The golf balls have gps, so a computer in your bay tracks where you land. There are several options of games to play that you select on said computer. There are several clubs to chose from in each bay. The bays also have heaters that do a good job of keeping the seating area warm when it is cold out. Each bay also has a table, chairs, and a server for drinks and food.  While visiting this morning we ordered a few mimosas and beers, and our server was quick in bringing them out. We definitely want to try one of the "Golfbag" drinks if we're ever back in the evening.  It can be pricey but the prices increase later in the day, so you can plan a visit early in the day to save money. We went around 10 a.m. this morning and it was still decently busy. It was $25/bay/hour until noon. You can have up to 6 people in a bay, so you can come with friends to make it more affordable.  Overall, a very fun experience for any group. We will continue to visit!

OPEQVbVA9zwojvvceuy0bw.text: Golf was fine. However, service was horrible. Took over 40 minutes for a server to greet us. In the two hours I was there we had a server check in on us twice. The service here has progressively gotten worse and it wasn't good to begin with.

k-iXhM9XeypapgIlOdIdjA.text: Great fun! Even if you are not into golf, you will have fun. We waited about an hour for our bay. Drinks were great at the downstairs bar. Service was good, food was good, drinks were not once we got upstairs. It was a great time.

n5xArghOcpxXR0ZnOiR7Qg.text: I always enjoy top golf. The food is good and the drinks always do the job. I've tried several menus and drinks on the menu and they have all been goods The staff is always helpful and attentive. It's a nice time to enjoy as a group. Even non golfers can enjoy the ambiance and social aspect of top golf.

x8tNdMAeFIeKo5oKY9uvRQ.text: We had a great time here. We didn't really know what to expect but it ended up being a great experience. Atmosphere is amazing. And the customer service was phenomenal. We had someone explain the game to us. Another person was our bay waiter and was very attentive. You pay for the bay by the hour and it's hard to judge how long you will need to finish a game especially for your first time. But you always have the option to extend it which is nice.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars are that the food options were limited and the alcohol drinks were very much watered down and not worth the prices.  My suggestion, eat after and just enjoy the game while you're there!

RCvN1eW2QqRKr4iyt5Z0dA.text: Topgolf is definitely worth the experience whether you are a golfer or you have never been golfing a day in your life. I had never been to something quite like this place before, however I enjoyed it. It was very lively and very self explanatory. The staff was friendly as well as helpful. If you go to Topgolf though I wouldn't order the food unless your starving. The food was subpar. We got the bbq sliders,wing trio, salsa and chips ( which we got guacamole with and Queso) the queso was oily and the chips were the kind you receive at the movie theater. The wings on the other hand weren't bad just wasn't crazy about the sauces. Other than the food just being okay, we had a great time. Playing golf in it's self with your friends and family especially when some aren't the greatest was enjoyable. Next time I honestly just won't order the food next time and just get drinks.

1Q8AQHdRFFKCw-2ACfF3yw.text: Despite the wait time and slow-ish service, this place is a lot of fun. Food is pretty decent and not overtly expensive. The wings were juicy and flavorful. Definitely rubbed or brined overnight. The GOAT sandwich was good. Service was slow in the beginning. We were upstairs in the outdoor seating area and waited about 20 minutes with no wait staff.  We eventually gave our order to the bartenders at the outdoor bar. Food came out quick after that. Splitting the bill wasn't a big deal which was good.   We got there around 12:30 and was told the wait was 2.5 hours. There were 5 of us total so wr got drinks and food in thr meantime. They had giant bucket beerpong and other games scattered throughout the building, like foosball, pool tables, shuffleboard, etc... around the 2 hr mark i went to check up on our time and they said they could get us a bay. Service was great from there on forward. It was most of our first time playing the top golf games and it was a lot of fun. It wasnt expensive, time went by quick. Definitely a great way to spend a beautiful saturday.

Q6sZkayH_IKrBkS7bKSJiA.text: I need one of these closer to where I live in PA!  I love how it takes the idea of the driving range and adds something better and more enjoyable to it.     We used Topgolf as an event at the close of a corporate meeting and used the private event services.   I really liked how we had our host waiting for us in the lobby to take us to our private area along with dedicated servers.  We selected the backyard bbq menu and it didn't disappoint.  Everyone seemed really into the chicken ( as a veggisaurus I'll take their word for it) and I can tell you I think the mac and cheese was pretty good.   I'll be honest, I didn't fully understand the point system other than the concept of "get your ball into one of the giant holes in the ground" for points.  Apparently I was pretty good at it as I beat everyone else in the bay I was on.  I'm more of a mini golf person, so this was shocking to me as well as the people that are way more into golf than I am.  In terms of private parties, this location was great to work with and made for a great way to end a business event.

1zfrv-gTrNrX39HZTT_rTw.text: Venue:  Too busy. It was fun once we got a tee, but I'm not sure the 4 hour wait was worth it. We came at 5 p.m. and got a tee at 910 p.m. The extra amenities like pool and shuffle board made the time go by a little quicker.   Food: I got a fried chicken sandwich and it was very salty. Like so salty I had to take the breading off. The prices were reasonable and normal which was nice. There is actually a huge drinking crowd that isn't even golfing drinking inside and watching.

PSqA3j1Ime1xSBURqTz13g.text: Ok so here's a few quick things about me: -I am super competitive -I love food -I love booze -I am AWFUL at golf, but I have the heart of a champion  So Topgolf incorporates all of those things which makes me LOVE it. The food isn't just bar food, but they have unique bites such as a donut holes that you can stuff with gooey chocolate, or charcuterie board that's a giant pretzel stuffed with all the meats and cheeses. I'm a BIG fan of the backyard baked wings,the burgers, and their new spring meatballs.   Anyone can play topgolf. You do not have to be good. You just have to try to get it into their targets. We've gone with some amazing golfers, but they cannot hit a target for the life of them. The driving range is heated, so when we went for New Year's Eve it still had the heat blowing to keep us warm. As someone who is always cold, I love that feature.  The only call out I would suggest is helping some of the wait staff. My husband and I are in a couples league at TG and we come every Monday. We grab our dinner while we're playing. Out of the six weeks we have went, two times my drink was wrong, three times my food was brought cold, and the majority of the 6 times in all the staff were MIA or bored out of their minds leaning on the wall.   Don't get me wrong, that's not going to harsh my competitive vibe. But it will def harsh me ordering more cocktails and/or enjoying the delicious snacks...which can be good or bad for me (depending on the Monday).  Pro Tip-Try to get the second or third floor bays

csy_odgpl8OeNDmneULz_A.text: Was so stoked when I found out this place was coming to Charlotte. Even if you are not a golfer this place is where it's at for a fun time. As soon as I walked through the door I was like a kid at Disneyworld.   I started the evening at the bar for a drink as we waited for the rest of our party to arrive.  I will say that this place is always packed so be prepared to wait before you are able to enter the bay. If they build the new location in north Charlotte, I think that will help with the wait times. My recommendation until that happens would be to get the VIP pass so you can make a reservation. Hey, I am not complaining about the wait tho when you can have a drink at a bar. They also serve food here which I have not tried yet but hear it is pretty good.  Maybe next visit I will try some food.  Once we got in the golf bay on the upper deck ( they have a few levels) let the games begin. So many different games to play and for all skill levels.  The net is not too deep at 215 feet and the targets are fairly large. The  scoring is done by micro chip balls when they land in targets and the closer to the flag in the middle the more points. Those are the basic rules but don't worry because a friendly staff member will set you up when you arrive to the bay. They will explain and answer any questions. I noticed some would bring their entire set of golf clubs but I find that is a little aggressive perhaps. Personally I think the clubs they provide in the stations for both men and women are decent. They are graphite shafts and I prefer stiff flex steel shafts so next visit I will probable bring a couple clubs of my own.   In case you can't tell, this place is awesome and will be back. I have been twice now but will tell you up front it is a little pricey but worth it. Best bet is get a group and split the cost of the bay rental. It is like 45 bucks for a hour after 5 and 25 before noon. 35 I think from the hours of 12-5. Then you get food and drinks and that is an expensive outing.   Going during the day at cheaper rate is more my speed anyways as it gets really loud at night with the music and crowd. Almost feels like a club. Also, come here for the fun and not necessarily to work on your golf game- go to the range for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States

Hpp0--H0zIHydw_R15NxMw.text: Such a great addition to the Charlotte area!  When I think of a driving range, I think of a slightly dingy place where you bring a couple of clubs, grab a basket of balls, and hit about an hours worth of shots off an open tee.  This is definitely NOT this place.  Top Golf is really best for groups, especially non-golfers.  They have a full set of both Women's and Men's clubs, so you don't have to bring your own if you don't want to.  I would say the more competitive groups had their own clubs, and the ones just playing for fun did not.  We were there for my boyfriend's birthday, so we had a group of all skill levels.  We chose to play the game where you just try to hit as close to the center of the target as possible (the further you hit it, and the closer to the center of the target you get, the more points they give you).  Great because you can score a lot of points hitting the center of a close target for those of us who are terrible at golf!  They also have regular games, scrambles, etc.  Something for everyone!  Form what I understand, all of the balls have RFID so it will show you where your ball landed on a screen.  I just need to knock this place for the food service.  It took almost TWO HOURS to get food, and we had to extend our time an extra hour (which they felt bad about us doing), but they were great in their response on fixing the situation.  Our waitress was certainly available when we needed her, and hopefully next time I go, the food will come out quicker.  Just a warning, it gets windy on the third level (where I was playing), so hold onto your drinks!  Overall, I had a fantastic time and I highly recommend this place if you go early.  We waited an hour on a Monday night, which was just enough time to hang out and have a drink at the bar.  I have to say my favorite part of the night was when it got dark, the targets on the range lit up, and flickered to the beat of the techno music.  Fun time and I'll be back!!!

Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Froze drink has a strawberry frozen in an ice cube!

7B1CXxXDOh_3H-xltVs52Q.text: Decided to go check this place out for my Birthday with my Husband.  They recently opened this location in Charlotte so I expected it to be busy.  There was a fair amount of people there for a Tuesday afternoon.  If you don't already have a membership then you have to wait in line and purchase a membership card.  This cost $5 per person and they ask for some personal information.  You only have to do this for your first visit and credits for play are added to it.   We tried to use a gift card that we had and their system wasn't working.  The manager was called over and he could tell we were getting frustrated because we got there 20 minutes before the hourly rate increases and check in was taking long.  He apologized and was very polite.  To fix the issue he credited us two hours of play when we were intending to play one and gave us the gift card back.   This was a very nice thing he did to make us feel special for my birthday and first visit.    Now onto the play.  The clubs are included but you can bring your own if you want. The technology is top notch and the games are fun even if you aren't a golfer.  Our food and drink server was very nice and efficient.    We ordered Moscow Mules, the Mushi and the Buffalo Chicken flatbread.  My Husband and I really enjoyed the flatbread and Mules.  The Mushi was good but we probably wouldn't order it again.  All in all we had a great time.  You will drop some cash at this place but the atmosphere and service make it worth it...we will be back for active fun and special occasions.

TFy4XkJualhbx-tsPzrYLw.text: At long last TopGolf CLT!  Me & James flew into town on Friday and made a beeline to TopGolf to meet up with Ben & Dora. A great weather day and the staff was enthusiastic about getting everyone checked in and in a bay.  It wasn't long after we arrived that we were enjoying some great cold beverages, appetizers and swinging away!  Our server Toni took care of us and made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. The food quality is good and the prices are a bit on the high side but it's worth it.  I've been to the TopGolf Alexandria, Va, the 1st one and also the one in Sterling, Va. This one is a little different in that it does;'t have the surround sofas at the bays. All but a couple have the high top tables which are really better if your eating.  Is you like golf and being outside with your friends, you'll like this place.

kWFHfG9F8iu_XrnbLk3eXw.text: What's not to love about top golf.   Pro tip- go on Wednesdays for college night if you have an ID it's a discount and don't have to sign up for a membership card it's just free play. Great place for a date night or to go with a big group.

CLjgeKvDdrUeFx6H5wdIIQ.text: Horrible service. Took forever to get waited on, then order was wrong and once I did get correct food I moved tables and they threw it away. Waitress told manager it was only a lil piece left  I don't care how much was left if I'm paying I want ALL my food. Not everyone serving was bad just two young ladies and manager was pretty off too. The young men were very helpful though. I wish I remembered their names but don't.

d7B16PoHi01XR7v1rWVtwg.text: This place is great. Food is good considering it's a good place but they will have a server and cater to you while you golf. Awesome time. Still open in the rain.

QEJW_PFh2Fj6AhLgXlzULA.text: I totally enjoyed my time at Top Golf! It was my first time playing golf in years. The atmosphere was booming and the drinks are good! My bf and I ordered one cabana golf bag drink for our meals & ordered another one after! Highly recommend the cabana. My fried chicken sandwich with slaw was kind of disappointing. The meat was dry and the slaw was so little. It looked nothing like the picture. The server asked if I wanted it on the side and I said no. I'll probably do that next time so that I could get more. It was literally a tablespoon on my chicken burger. We went on a Friday night and it was packed but worth the wait. It's less than 10 minutes away from my home so I will definitely be a regular there! There were other menu items that I would like to try so that will definitely be something I would go back for too!

GK7nm8a-VPQD8bVNN2ZeMw.text: This top golf is amazing they are very nice  and welcoming. I went there for the cam Newton jam and they treated us very well.

30hbm8ZtVdOfmdrnpAsIrg.text: Fun place to go! Definitely a pain waiting to get your initial member card...very loud in lobby and with the high popularity it's a mad house, especially on Saturday's. Once you get your card it's much smoother. The wait staff are great, at least ours was. Food is aight, I'd pass on it since it's expensive enough as it is to just play. It's much better when you split the cost per hour with friends. Hour is fun, two hours is plenty, especially if you suck at golf and bend your wrist (ouch).   I will definitely be bringing more out of town guests to play golf, it's a cool place to go!

Np-TbgIRl90sC5pSnnPcJg.text: The idea behind Topgolf is awesome, but the execution is lacking. We came in on a Saturday night, so we were expecting a wait but when we were told 3 hours at 8pm I felt that that was a bit excessive. But I was super excited, so we decided to wait it out. We sat in the bar area on the main floor which was very crowded and lively-had a good vibe! It took a while for someone to come up to us, a few different waitresses kept asking if we had been helped yet and we said no still to not have anyone come actually take an order for about 10 minutes. Fortunately, we didn't mind because we were waiting for another couple to join us. In the meantime, we ordered drinks from the bar(got id'd which is fine....once) but then throughout the rest of the night we all had to show our ids about 3-4 more times to different people even though we clearly had drinks and had already been ID'd. But that was the least of my concerns throughout the night  When our friends got there, they had just sat down, took off their coats and a waiter going by spilt old, eaten food all over our friend and his jacket. He barely received an apology and had to persuade someone who was the manager I'm guessing who finally came over to give him an appetizer on the house(in my opinion should have been offered right away).  Our waitress was not very attentive and in the middle of my order pulled out her cellphone. I was blown away. Being in the restaurant business for a long time, I have never seen anyone do this at a table! And as soon as that happened, I knew that our order was going to be messed up(on top of being on her phone, she wasn't writing anything down). And big surprise, our orders came out all messed up. So needless to say, we were not happy.  We had to send one plate back and by the time it came back out we were moving outside to start playing golf. I will say, once we got out there, our experience at Topgolf improved tenfold! We had a fantastic waitress and it was much warmer outside than it was inside.  Overall, I really like the idea of Topgolf, but unfortunately most of our experience was ruined by some of the staff and how inattentive they were.

YDsFWP2TXcu-ZLCa5ua8Zg.text: Top Golf is absolutely amazing and the service I received was tremendous. While booking a event for my company I had the pleasure of working with Jordan the event planner. He was great and very patient with me on my decision making. He allowed me to come twice to review the location and also experience what my team would experience.  I also had the opportunity to work with Steven for our corporate platinum membership which my company is EXTREMELY thrilled to be apart of. Being able to allow our clients to enjoy a nice day of golfing and networking are two wins!   The food I really good! Be sure to try the donut holes which are addictive and fries! I had a Moscow Mule and to all my Moscow peeps be sure to get one, so good!   We are thrilled to be apart of what will be the hottest place in Charlotte. Thank you top golf and everyone that has made my experience superb!

poVD6sYDgWyNjjJAeiKY5Q.text: Let me begin by saying they have only been open a week so the delay in time was expected. We waited in line for about 45 minutes and got checked in. The wait took about 2.5 hours. Once the "hype" dies down I'm sure it won't be like that all the time.   There is a small seating area downstairs where you can eat with maybe 15-20 tables. They have pool tables too. However my table only ordered some fries, a burger, and wings and it took nearly an hour and a half just to get it. Again, they're new they just open but as someone who's worked as a server when you tell me your food runners/servers don't know the table numbers or where to take it that's disconcerting and not that hard to learn. Everything we ordered had issues my friend and daughter were missing items and I got something different than what I ordered. Overall, the eating experience was okay.   When we finally got our bay we had an absolute blast. We will definitely be back for that and probably recommending reserving a spot before hand but since we were able to sit down and eat the wait didn't seem as long as it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not exactly what we ordered; backyard wings, kids tenders, tiny side salad.

b1PTPuzqifR9Rp6uFoNRwA.text: We visiting on Opening Night (June 9) and LOVED it!!!  I honestly don't know what I can possibly say that hasn't already been said so I will keep it short and to the point. This place ROCKS!  I'm not a golfer and still thoroughly enjoyed my time there. The food is excellent, they have a great drink menu and the atmosphere is fun and fabulous!   We had the pleasure of dining on the second floor and then drinking/playing on the third floor and both of our BayHosts were outstanding (Vanessa on the 2nd fl and Kyle L on the 3rd fl). They were both incredibly friendly and attentive. They knew the menu, made perfect recommendations, and they're engaging personalities genuinely made the whole experience that much better.   My husband and I had the Hummus appetizer, a burger, and chicken nachos and we loved it all. Everything was served hot and fresh and was seasoned perfectly.   We also had an opportunity to spend some time at the rooftop bar and the bar staff was also fantastic! They were just as entertaining as they were friendly. I was DD for the night so I only nursed a couple of Sangrias for my entire time there, but my husband had a few diff beers and another drink. Next time, he will be DD so I can get one of their signature Golf Bag drinks!  Everyone was raving about them!  One thing that my husband and I consistently noticed and commented on a number of times is how much the employee truly seem to like their jobs and enjoy working there. As CRAZY busy as the place was and the demand that was put on the staff, everyone that we came into contact with embraced the madness and passed along their excitement to the customers. Kudos to Top Golf for bringing this fun establishment to Charlotte and for obviously going out of your way to make it a fun and pleasant work experience for your employees.   BTW...I can't wait to go back to try the breakfast menu!

_RgzSSOh3pAQkZG2phF3qw.text: This was my 5th visit to the Top Golf in Charlotte and each time the service is worse than the time before. I'll admit, yes, the concept is genius and me and my group always have a great time with the golfing portion of the day, however aside from the physical swinging of the golf club the rest of the experience is needing serious improvement. The service is among the worst I've experienced. On this particular visit, my group of 8 had to wait for a bay (completely understandable on a Saturday afternoon) so we decided to grab a late lunch at the bar and have some drinks. It took about 20 mins for a waitress to even approach our table and then another 25-30 mins for us to receive our drinks. We then had to chase down another waitress to place a food order, since ours was sitting at the bar completely disinterested in the needs of the customers. After about an hour of waiting, half the table received their food then the other half of the table received their orders about 30 minutes later. Within a two and half hour waiting period, our "waitress" came to our table to refill drinks/ check on our food/ check on the table as a whole about 2 times. Quite honestly, I was surprised by the lack of service. The wait staff seemed incredibly young and they all just crowded around the bar talking, right behind our table (literally bumping into our table several times because the staff was horsing around and being rowdy), for the entire 2 and a half hours. The service wasn't commendable once we were at our bay, but anything was an improvement from the disaster that was our dining/ drinking experience in their "bar/restaurant". While my group may be back to play golf, I can guarantee you we will not be returning to the bar/restaurant. Save your time and your money and eat before you go!

wx4xjTna5o5SJuv5N3ozhQ.text: Fun atmosphere, had a great time. Server was really nice and the drinks were strong but reasonably priced. Could have had more instruction on using the technology but otherwise great afternoon weekend date spot

g8J8E3GwIhaMgoEOG8uJyg.text: Just wanted share that I emailed about the hero's discount and I was really disappointed that some of our CLT's heroes are excluded.  While I agree with giving a discount to everyone who serves the community this does not extend to Nurse Teachers or Doctors who are also heroes in our community and I would hope you would change your policy to add those who also sacrifice so much of themselves to serve the CLT area.

edrVDVouPldgoZ99X4MgJQ.text: Deshawn was awesome! Great food, exactly what you order, every time. Servers are great and food is excellent!

M1LLW7epMMFNtEQ1CEoh6w.text: My husband and I are huge fans of topgolf.. but we both agree that this location is an absolute disaster. We will give it another shot in a few months.

pbNSUSHGd-vK4magx7VDyw.text: Very fun place to go to with family and friends. Food is great, as is the atmosphere.

cIr-67ii7WS8UygItRPFdA.text: After hearing about the magic of Top Golf from friends in DC, I was curious to know how it would stack up against their experiences. Going on a Friday at noon, our group anticipated being able to go straight in and get a bay. As we drove up and saw almost every parking spot filled, we quickly realized it'd be a bit more complicated than that. Check-in was fairly simple; first-time visits require you buy a $5 member card that you use at every Top Golf location in the country. We availed ourselves of the spacious bar area while we waited on a bay to come open. Prices are fair, and the beer is cold. Once our bay came open, an attendant escorted us to it, helped check us in, and we were on our way. Wait staff tended to us throughout the afternoon, and both the drinks and food were good. The golf in and of itself is great fun, with a variety of modes available for everyone from beginners to scratch golfers. They could do with some better fans to keep the air moving during the summer, but it did little to dampen the mood.

8VT1Y1Lay46J9KEK54Apdw.text: We arrived and it was 1.5 hour wait for a bay to open and decided to have a drink and bite to eat while waiting. We got a seat immediately and waited 18 minutes for someone to greet us and take our drink order. Many employees walked past us and didn't a knowledge. A couple more groups sat down and the waitress decided to clean tables and sweep rather than acknowledge and take orders. You could tell there were issues as other tables sent back food and management had to go to other tables. Our food was terrible. We ordered a quesadilla and pretzel bites. The quesadilla was cheese in a tortilla shell and the beer cheese with pretzel bites was sour and the worst I have ever tasted. We did not eat. I so regret spending our money on the food for the terrible service and terrible food. The hour of of went well. I would recommend just golfing and do t sit in restaurant to eat. I wish I had my $45 back.

vt-bvl4DX_oi2BrfIl-IrQ.text: Great place to go.  Problem is if you want answers to your questions you either have to get them from the website or physically go to the location.  Their automated system is mind numbing.  Expensive system but extremely frustrating for someone who wants to ask another human being a question rather than listen to robots that sound like all they drink is coffee and Red Bull.

aU3RBz-yhsv7C94F-mNw-w.text: The food is great. Service was good and the atmosphere is a great time with friends. You can tell they've put a lot of effort to ensure this place runs smoothly.

yr3cTCZg5eHy2030JSiaCg.text: Update: went again to find out 3.5 hr wait on a Thursday night. They should have wait time on app and website. The parking lot is terrible. t-ZXFnpfnSEHWb7rYcRkJQ.text: This was my first time at Top Golf. We got there at 9.30 and was told it would be a 4hr wait. We decided not to Golf but just experience the bar and food area. CMwaK3lxCa2BglI9O19mIg.text: Waited 3.5 hours paying $6 a beer. Yea. Only to be told we'd have to wait another hour or more. All the while, larger parties came and went...Topgolfing away. Not sure what we did to piss that little punk B off behind the counter, but their whole seating system is F-Ed. Not to mention, ONE waitress trying to take care of the entire 3rd floor bar. 30 minutes to get a bucket of beer. Probably closer to 45. The whole place is a huge joke. If you're looking to drink $6 beers with some of the largest douche bags in the city, go put that name on the waiting list and enjoy the scenery. DO NOT go here.

kXWTYZQi78s4IrjkFBRVeA.text: Just left after spending an hour and a half online, in 90 degree weather, in the sun.., for our fathers day plans....well at that point a girl told us theres a 3 and a half hr wait to get a suite to golf....and u need a membership card..which i knew about the card and read up online about but I didnt know the spider web of lines that we were gonna have to endure for our fathers day visit...btw my party have been looking forward to comng to top golf ...theres was 3 or 4 different lines that u need to go thru for the "card". I was willing to wait for my family. But they didnt want too. We are very disappointed in the maze of lines that we had would if gone thru but to achieve wat other companys do so gracefully. gjskLAs-KrJ4YKsLwVBm0Q.text: So much potential but totally lacking in execution! The experience starts with there being nowhere near enough parking so you either have to stalk people leaving for 20 minutes to snag a spot or pay for valet. Also, they don't seem willing to help arrange groups play together even when there are booths open side by side. Oh well, at least it's overpriced!

FIQTafvVefjQVJRrTCTufA.text: Terrible experience today make sure you have a reservation otherwise be prepared to wait 4 hrs . We were told 1 hr 1/2 and and later requested to speak to another customer service employee and then were sprung upon the decision that we had to wait another couple hours. My daughter has never been here and we invited our former family member down for the weekend in NC to show him around. This was one of our options to have them experience and it was an awful one. I've never felt so bad in my life wasting their time when we could've been doing other things. We figured we'd eat here as well and waited patiently to be put into a bay. We were not very happy with the outcome of our Saturday evening with the family. Wouldn't recommend this at all unless you request a reservation.
